I'm not new to BR games and definetly not new to shooters so at first I thought I just need to learn the weapons and recoil better to win the 1v1 engagements. Once you get better you sometimes lose to the enemy just having better positions than you do and once you check out the deathcam you know your skill doesn't matter one bit because 70% of the times you die to aimbots. That said my next issue is that the anti cheat in in this game is non existent, that you can report the cheaters where you're 100% certain they cheat (maybe im just too bad to flickshot between 4 people and kill them all within 2 seconds with an m416 at 40m range) and even then they do not get banned or they will only get temporarily banned for a week. Since it's f2p they probably got multiple cheating accounts anyway and they dont give a damn about a temp. ban. Also atleast 20-30% of combatatants in each game are bots.

Gunplay feels fun, there's an abundance of loot (and often cars) everywhere so it doesnt mean too much if you looted your perfect gear for 10 minutes, played another 10 minutes of hiking simulator or chase the zone simulator and died to a single headshot right after reaching the action.

On the positive side you can drive around in an ice cream truck play stupid music and run over people which is enough fun to keep playing this game until super people releases and I can finally uninstall pubg for good. 


10/10 would drive ice cream truck again

准备购买CSGO的同学要注意下面几点！
1：最好别碰箱子【这种比运气的东西就跟赌博一样，一开根本停不下来，除非你认为你自己是个欧洲人，不然最好别去碰箱子，安安心心的去买皮肤吧！】
2：升级经验是固定的，不管你是多少级，升级都是固定的5000点。每周升级都可以随机获得一个喷漆【有次数限制】或者一把皮肤枪，不过基本都不值钱，每周只能获得一次。40级满级后可以转生，回到1级，同时会送你一个今年的服役勋章，比如你17年满级转生，就送你17年的服役勋章，简单来说这勋章就是拿来好看的。
3：平衡性，不用我说了，皮肤没有任何属性加成，所以不用担心遇到什么人名币战士。
4：CT和T都有自己阵营的特色武器，比如CT的M4A1，T的AK47。【说这个就是想吐槽我有一个萌新朋友抓着我问为什么CT买不了AK47，T买不了M4A1。说实话我可以笑他一年，23333】
5：现在到了2级就能打竞技了，并且定级赛并不是让你定级打10把，而是让你赢10把，赢了10把才算定级完成。每赢2把会冻结你的竞技模式，无法打竞技，这是以你赢的两把的战绩还有之前输的几把比赛帮你测评你的水平，冻结时间结束后才能继续打竞技。定级完成后你才可以随心所欲的打竞技了！
6：一定要小心一些陌生人，有些心怀不轨的人会加你好友给你发链接，这个时候别去点链接，也别信那些人说的我用XXX元买你刀啊皮肤之类的，这些家伙们都不是什么好人。【提这个是因为在贴吧里不止一次看到有人被骗了。】
7：现在CSGO分两种服务器，国服和国际服，国服目前在18号前没有激活码是没法玩的，激活码自己去百度搜索CSGO完美官网去抢，国服和谐有点严重，血变成石油了，恐怖份子变成了****和谐符号等等。对于国际服玩家，VPN的话我比较建议网易UU和奇游。国际服玩家想转国服的话，跟DOTA2转国服一样，鼠标右键游戏点击属性，在属性页面选择【设置启动选项】，在启动选项中输入—perfectworld steam，确定，然后就可以玩国服了，不过国际服玩家没有激活码也是没办法在18号前进行匹配的。[10.2]这次CSGO更新后，好像打开游戏是让我们自行选择哪个服务器，可以选择国服也可以选择国际服，如果有什么遗漏的欢迎留言补充，这也是我最后一次更新评测了吧。
8:[8.5]最近V社在封中国饰品网机器人，导致中国玩家损失惨重，所以第八条建议，最好是等这次风波过后再用。还是那句话，理性消费才是关键。
最近混了混饰品交易网，饰品交易网主要还是看信誉，不清楚的萌新可以去问问百度贴吧的老哥们，饰品交易网最深的坑就是类似于赌博性质的“抽奖”，这抽奖很容易亏钱，相信有些氪金老哥很清楚的，交易网用来提现或者买枪都可以，但是我不建议去花钱“抽奖”，非常坑，真的非常坑。【7.30】因为某饰品交易网的事情搞得很多人被坑，因为我早就不玩饰品了，就不予评价，不过不是这次事件，某网的黑点也够多的，比如以前被串号转库存这些事情不少有，不过这次更新不说这个，这次我想教下萌新们安全地卖皮肤：去百度贴吧，饰品交易吧把你想要卖的饰品信息挂到贴吧里，跟别人谈价，等确定买家之后走饰品网，挂好饰品后把信息告诉买家，让他买。注意一点，这个是最重点的，无论什么情况，所有交易必须都是走饰品交易网，若他非要不用交易网和你进行交易的话，请不要跟他浪费时间，这种饰品交易不走交易网还会去市场？这种人不走交易网就是想坑走你的饰品，那种“买家”会要你去其他什么狗P网站交易，然后再申诉把钱拿回来，走饰品交易网至少不会被骗，目前由于某网出了这么大的事情，肯定有萌新在思考用什么交易网，因为我出了饰品坑所以也不好说哪些，但是我们有万能的百度贴吧老哥们，萌新可以去问CSGO吧的兄弟们什么交易网可靠，记得没错的话，好像置顶帖就有教的，然后饰品交易过程，最好是越短越好，所以要先找到买家再去挂饰品交易网，十几块的皮肤不需要用我这个，但是几百块以上的最好要先找到买家，再直接挂交易网，这次某网事件我就不说什么了，最后给各位萌新留一个提醒：饰品是个大坑，切勿沉迷饰品，别因为一时冲动，吃半月尘土。
9：国服出了后，为了少点萌新被骗，我给第6条补充一下，先说说目前骗子骗人的骗法吧，基本上想买你的刀或者找你打联赛的，全都是骗子。有人以前好奇，说为什么不能点链接，我就给你们讲讲吧，这是库存链接，对于绑了手机安全令牌的还好，没绑的绝对会出事，它会把你所有库存交易给对方，手机还好可以确认是否交易，但是没绑手机令牌的同学就惨了。然后别以为有手机安全令牌就可以随便浪了，有些黑客早已经弄了个盗号网站，等着你浪呢。目前骗子最喜欢用的手法是打联赛缺人来骗你，因为是机器人自动发话，我就给你们讲讲骗子一般怎么骗人的吧。
骗子：我们联赛缺一个人，你打什么位置？
萌新：？？？
骗子：行，我知道了，你加下我们领队，她会告诉你更多。XXXX【这是库存交易链接】
这时候，只需要删除好友即可，别想着去调戏，这是电脑人不会回复你的。
------------分割线------------

There's no way to quickly remove it from your computer without having to delete system files and removing registry lines. With no official response on how to actually completely remove Wellbia from your system you have to rely on community threads online to figure it out.

Having these files present on your computer inhibit you from using the memory integrity security feature on windows. Factoring in the huge amount of cheaters still rampant in PUBG and this being a kernel level anti-cheat there's some obvious questions popping up.

Why did they set it to be constantly running?
Why are there still leftover processes constantly running after removing it?
Why isn't there an official way to completely uninstall it?

I don't recommend downloading this for the side dish of spyware you're installing, at the end of the day it might be bad implementation but installing a game with such a huge budget behind it shouldn't end up being a potential security risk.

If you want to check if you're affected and want to know how to remove it.
search for "Wellbia/XINGCOD3" online

INGREDIENTES
1 pollo mediano con piel
1⁄2 cucharada de romero seco
1⁄2 cucharada de pimienta negra molida
1⁄2 cucharada de comino
1⁄2 cucharada de sillao
1⁄2 cucharada de orégano en polvo
1 cucharada de ajo molido
1⁄2 cucharada de ají panca molido
1⁄2 taza de cerveza negra
Sal
Mantequilla
Agua

PREPARACIÓN
Echar 4 cucharadas de sal en una olla grande con agua y mover bien.
Sumergir el pollo entero y refrigerar en salmuera por 8 horas.
Picar el romero lo más chico posible y echarlo en un bol.
Agregar la pimienta negra y una cucharadita de sal. Añadir el comino, el sillao, el orégano, el ajo molido, el ají panca y la cerveza negra. Mezclar y rectificar la sal. Reservar esta marinada.
Sacar el pollo de la refrigeradora, escurrirlo y colocarlo en un bowl limpio.
Bañarlo con la marinada. Procurar introducir la mezcla entre la piel y la carne. Tapar el bowl con papel film y dejarlo reposar por al menos ocho horas más con la pechuga hacia abajo. Darle la vuelta un par de horas antes de sacarlo.
Transcurrido el tiempo, colocar el pollo en una bandeja o fuente para horno y pincelarlo con mantequilla por encima y dentro de la piel.
Cocinarlo en el horno a 270 ºC por 90 minutos (o 120 minutos si el pollo está muy frío).
Pasados los primeros 40 minutos, bañarlo con el jugo que quedó de la marinada. Girar la bandeja 3 o 4 veces durante la cocción para que se cocine parejo.
Volver a pincelar con mantequilla derretida unos 20 minutos antes de sacarlo. Mirar constantemente. Sacarlo del horno antes de que la piel empiece a dorarse demasiado o quemarse.

I am a 58 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he friended and invited me to join him. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

9 - AMAZING
A shooter that’s as invested in creating a smart, nuanced survival experience as it is fun, action-packed combat.

PlayerUnknown’s Battlegrounds has taken the military-sim gameplay popularized by games like ARMA and DayZ, boiled it down to its most exciting parts, and streamlined it into quick and accessible rounds of pure, hassle-free, survival-based action. Even though each game starts the same way, its remarkable ability to feel like a new, tense adventure each and every round has kept me coming back for hours on end.

After nearly 3,300 hours of gameplay... 
I have decided this game is NOT FUN to play. 

Someone else mentioned this game is like dating an alcoholic. I'd say it's more like being the alcoholic. It's not really that good, but the effect is such a high, it gets you hooked pretty easily. It lets you do all kinds of crazy stuff, but eventually you're not even thinking anymore and you realize you don't remember what you did 30 minutes ago let alone after staying up until 3AM playing it, only because the playercount starts dropping around 2AM. You wake up the next day and feel like shit because you got shitty rest, probably would've been better off doing something productive, or almost anything else at all, and you can't think of anything valuable it actually contributed to your life. You say you'll never do it again, but sure enough, the next night, there you are again, in the same spot, bottle in hand, sitting by yourself in an alleyway behind the bar, vomit down your front, crying about the girl you met a couple hours ago who said she was going home with you but is nowhere to be found. :( You say "thiz shit iz ztoopiddd..." and pass out. Wake up on the couch in your living room, reeking of booze and bile, negative balance in your bank account, and already 2 hours late to work.... 

Don't waste your time on this game.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Hackers/cheaters everywhere!!!! From aimboting, wall hacking, speed-reving, radar hacking, etc...you name it, they're everywhere. Yes I get that hackers are inevitable in online fps gaming, that's just unfortunate, but the sad part is when the devs don't even care or feel the need to do anything about it. Sure, you can report them but I highly doubt they even take it seriously. Just this past week, nearly every round I played has hackers using aimbot/norecoil script. Some of them are discrete while others are blatantly cheating in your face.. aka headshot through the fking wall. And honestly, it’s gotten to the point where the game is becoming pretty much unplayable and unenjoyable. It’s absurd.

Additionally, aside from the cheating, there's also a ridiculous amount of bugs in the game mechanics. So many times I lost a match all because of the bugs in the program (shots not hitting enemy, character getting stuck underground, vehicle flipping randomly, and worst of all, game keeps CRASHING RANDOMLY). Like seriously, this game is so unfinished and miles away from ever being considered as a polished game. The only reason I am playing is because it's free, I would NEVER spend real money on this crap. And seems like every update nowadays is only to roll out new skins for purchase, NEVER TO FIX THE BUGGY PROGRAMMING AND HACKER PROBLEM…just goes to show HOW MUCH the devs care about this game besides profit--NADA.

So yeah, I full-heartedly DO NOT recommend this game to anyone, unless they attempt to fix the bugs and cheating problem. But this is something that's been going on for quite some time and if they are going to do something about it, they would have done so already. So at this point, this game is pretty much a lost cause. And if that still isn’t enough of a wake up call to them, I am betting that not soon from now, this game will be featured on Youtube called “Death of a Game: PUBG”, sequel to "Death of a Game: H1Z1"

I see a lot of negative reviews, but consider this
1. Free to play
2. No pay to win, literally all purchases are cosmetic only
3. No skill-based matchmaking (though I see some of you reviewers complaining thatpros and noobs get matched together. CoD gets sh*t all the time for SBMM, and here you don't have it, deal with it and git gud, EARN your chicken dinner like the rest of us. Also, competetive ppl seem to be in FPP, play TPP if you want easy mode)
4. Queue for lobbies is fast 
5. Vehicle physics is improved so you don't die or do barrel rolls from the tiniest rock now
6. Plenty of weapon, customization, and map options.

Yeah, there are some bots in the game, but those are mostly all killed within first few mins of the game and don't really have a major impact other than being able to laugh at your friends if they get killed by one

PUBG! The one and only game that somehow requires bots to fill lobbies despite having constantly high player counts. Characterised by Level 500 sweats dunking on you, or massively padded stats due to the worst AI ever, this game will provide endless self hate that manages to compel you into giving PUBG your wallet. 
To be fair, the game is incredibly fun. Until I played PUBG, I hadn't played a game that racked up playtime this fast since the launch of R6S or Apex Legends. It's satisfying despite the arguably clunky movement system, it feels rewarding to get high kill games even in bot lobbies, and it's just an all round fun experience.

If only this game has little to no cheaters, this is by far the most skill-based raw battle royale game that you can play on. No extra gizmos just pure civilian to civilian survival game that would test your tactical capabilities, decisions, and gun handling.

After purchasing the game for full retail price before it went F2P and putting over 1800 hours into the game and a bit more for in-game purchases as well, the company has seen fit to permanently ban me without warning and at first, without reason.

I broke no rules, policies, TOS, or ROC they have.  I went through their 'ban appeals' process which is pointless as they do not look into the issue at all.  I spoke with a couple of different representatives in the appeals process and finally got a reason that they believe I used "unauthorized programs" which is certainly not true and I offered to assist them in any way possible with looking into this false positive.  They would not.  They have no interest in bettering their product for their consumers apparently, to prevent false bans.

Hindsight is 20/20 now but if you look at forums across the internet, this seems to be a common thing with PUBG and their company.  Not the usual insincere "I'm banned for no reason" posts as in other games/platforms, but a legitimate issue with the company randomly permanently banning legitimate people.  The PUBG community understands this and just rolls with it and tells those users to 'just create a new Steam account' because PUBG is F2P now.   This is ridiculous for people that want to follow the rules and use their true and only Steam account.

I have tried to go through their normal means for appealing and discussing with the company and they would not assist.  If they do decide to finally look into this issue, I will update/edit this if I can.

I cannot recommend anyone to put in any effort or money or to play this game as legitimate players will be at risk of being permanently banned, which in turn leaves a permanent mark on your overall Steam account causing friends/others to question you.

This game changed my life.

Let me start at the beginning. When I was in the third grade, I was constantly bullied by all the other kids in my school. They would call me mean names like 'Titty boy', and 'Stinky'. I got so depressed that I decided to just stay in my bed all the time. My mother used to come into my room and beat me with an iron spatula to try and get me to move. I never knew my father...

Six years later and I finally decided it was time for a change. I went back to school and rejoined the third grade, but this time it was worse. I was so much older than all the other kids and no one wanted to be my friend, not even the teacher. One day, during recess, they told me to stand by the school wall and they took turns throwing rocks at me. I suffered severe brain damage and had several broken ribs. 

Later that year my mother died. Before she passed away on her death bead, she told me one thing. And I honestly don't remember what it was. 

I had to move in with my uncle and I dropped out of school once again. My uncle had an old ratty laptop laying around that he used to let me play solitaire on. I loved the digitized movement of the cards so much that I decided to steal my uncles money from his safe and buy a real gaming computer. 

Fast forward ten years and I was officially a master at every video game I touched. Then I discovered this little indie title called "Player Unknown's Battle-Grounds". From that moment on everything changed. My mother and father came back to life, all the third graders in my old class came forward and apologized to me. Even my teacher!

I now live happily in a mansion with my seven wives, twelve super-cars, and billions of dollars. 

Thank you PUBG, I will be forever grateful to you.

I mean, I 've been playing this game almost since it got released. Lots of hours wasted, lots of fun stuff have happened in PUBG's battlegrounds. Unfortunately, I will have to say that it's one of the best battle royals in the market, that focuses on gun-play, and not on building mechanics, or magic spells or whatever. That says a lot, because ...

On the downsides, the game has a lot of cheaters, even with the 3-4 anti-cheats they have added into the game. Bugs and crashes are not uncommon, even on high-end rigs. For a new player, up to level 80, you will face mostly bots on your games - and there is nothing you can do about it. Finally, the company is extremely greedy, which is reflected upon their market, that is filled with overpriced digital clothing and skins, that many of them are not even marketable.

If you have friends to play this game, go ahead. Otherwise, stay away from it, as far as possible.

Overall I give it a nice 6/10.

PUBG was a fantastic game in a vacuum. When there were no comparable BRs, it reigned supreme in being fun and replayable despite its clunky mechanics. Fast forward to current times however and games such as Fortnite, Apex, and Super People showcase how much better BR gameplay can be with crisp player control.

It feels a little unfair for me to not recommend this game after 200+ fun hours, but if Fortnite, Apex, or Super People existed back when I started playing PUBG, I would have jumped ship very quickly.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I fart around in this PUBG from time to time and I've always enjoyed it. I stopped seriously playing in 2018 when the *hackers* (who were apparently #1) were ruining almost every game I'd queue into. Shooting me through a mountain with a perfect headshot and screaming heinous things about my entire family in something that could only vaguely be described as English. That kind of fun stuff. 

It's not like that anymore from what I can tell. So far so good. I played H1z1 and DayZ back in the day and really liked both of those, so at the time of the initial release of PUBG it immediately felt like a big step up in spite of the issues. I'm a Modern Warfare fan also but I don't care for Warzone. Fortnite would be great, but since I'm not a fetus, It's not for me. That means this is the only Battle Royale game I mess with and I'm glad it's still alive and well. I know people think this game is terrible, and in many ways it is, but that doesn't stop it from being fun...if you like that kind of thing.

There's barely anything enjoyable in this game compared to other BR's. Movement speed is slow and clunky, TTK is instant, you have to travel 500 km to the next zone while everyone camps bridges or other things that basically is there just to F you over. Most people even keep hiding in zones to make sure YOU do not get out of there alive even if it means that they won't be able to escape. Healing is damn annoying because you can't even heal yourself to max without these stupid energy cans or painkillers so if you get attacked shortly after you've dealt with someone so is it over for you. The game is also overrun by bots, or at least that what it feels like. Some of them legit just keep running into walls or just stand there looking at you not even shooting back. I thought this game had a healthy player base why the need of these cringe bots? I came here to play against real players not this kindergarten warfare BS. 

P.S 99% of my hours are around the time when the game first gained popularity and the game was fine back then because there really wasn't any alternatives out there and there were ZERO bots

[h1]The new privacy policy is insane,[/h1]

it allows them to acess and store (*and share) ridiculous amounts of information that they have no buisiness knowing. 

I have puchased this game years ago and now they block me from playing it unless i forefeit my right to privacy? 

I consider this to be fraud.


[b]Edit:[/b] here are some examples:

[b][u]information that they collect includes:[/u][/b]

 [quote]– Nickname, [b]phone number[/b], SteamID64(*), [b]purchase history[/b], etc. to provide and operate the game;*

– Nickname, [b]email address[/b], [b]device information[/b], and records of the issues you experience (to provide customer service)*, and 

– [b]Email address[/b], [b]gender[/b], [b]age[/b], [b]country of residence[/b], [b]language[/b], and information for delivering goods (i.e.[b] name[/b], [b]postal address[/b], and [b]phone number[/b])(for participation in the survey, and other events).*

 When you participate in social features (such as [b]in-game chat[/b]), the information that you disclose is public information. We may [b]store[/b] and [b]access[/b] it, and it may be [b]read[/b], [b]copied[/b], [b]collected[/b] or used by other users without your consent.[/quote]

*When they name a reason for collecting this and that information it doesn't legally bind them as far as I can tell.
It seems to be just an explanation for the reader, especially considering this list is under "information we collect" and not "how we use your information", that comes later.



[b][u]who they share the information with includes:[/u][/b]

[quote] [b]marketing platforms[/b] and [b]providers of analytics services relating to player behavior*[/b], in order to [b]tailor the Servic[/b]e and to [b]conduct marketing activities[/b] [/quote]

*this does not mean that they only share information that's necessary for the analytics, it means that they are allowed to share what they have with a company that provides those analytics services.
player behavior is also not limited to ingame activities, it can be simply activity of you, the player, as far as the wording goes.



[b][u]they also retain the right to give out your information if their company is aquired or merged.[/u][/b] 

[quote] [b]We may also[/b] [b] share your information[/b] where such disclosure is essential to comply with a legal obligation or a lawful data access request, [b]pursuant to a merger or acquisition[/b], [b]with our affiliates[/b] for the [b]purposes described[/b] in this Policy, [b]or[/b] where you have [b]otherwise provided* [/b]your consent or at your direction.[/quote]

*"or where you have otherwise provided your consent" reads like "We may share your information in such and such cases and also [b]however we see fit[/b] (as long as it's legal)" [b][i]bruh[/i][/b]💀


[b]please check out the privacy policy to see for yourself:[/b] [h1]https://na.battlegrounds.pubg.com/pp-steam/[/h1]
it's all there and not super hard to understand.

[h1]The "Anti-Cheat" provided with this game autoruns on your computer at launch even after uninstalling it.[/h1]
There's no way to quickly remove it from your computer without having to delete system files and removing registry lines. With no official response on how to actually completely remove Wellbia from your system you have to rely on community threads online to figure it out.

Having these files present on your computer inhibit you from using the memory integrity security feature on windows. Factoring in the huge amount of cheaters still rampant in PUBG and this being a kernel level anti-cheat there's some obvious questions popping up.

Why did they set it to be constantly running?
Why are there still leftover processes constantly running after removing it? 
Why isn't there an official way to completely uninstall it?

[b]I don't recommend downloading this for the side dish of spyware you're installing, at the end of the day it might be bad implementation but installing a game with such a huge budget behind it shouldn't end up being a potential security risk.[/b]

[i]If you want to check if you're affected and want to know how to remove it.[/i]
search for "Wellbia/XINGCOD3" online.

Vintage chocolate chip cookies

Ingredients
150g salted butter, softened
80g light brown muscovado sugar
80g granulated sugar
2 tsp vanilla extract
1 large egg
225g plain flour
½ tsp bicarbonate of soda
¼ tsp salt
200g plain chocolate chips or chunks
Method
STEP 1
Heat the oven to 190C/fan170C/gas 5 and line two baking sheets with non-stick baking paper.

STEP 2
Put 150g softened salted butter, 80g light brown muscovado sugar and 80g granulated sugar into a bowl and beat until creamy.

STEP 3
Beat in 2 tsp vanilla extract and 1 large egg.

STEP 4
Sift 225g plain flour, ½ tsp bicarbonate of soda and ¼ tsp salt into the bowl and mix it in with a wooden spoon.

STEP 5
Add 200g plain chocolate chips or chunks and stir well.

STEP 6
Use a teaspoon to make small scoops of the mixture, spacing them well apart on the baking trays. This mixture should make about 30 cookies.

STEP 7
Bake for 8–10 mins until they are light brown on the edges and still slightly soft in the centre if you press them.

STEP 8
Leave on the tray for a couple of mins to set and then lift onto a cooling rack.

RECIPE TIPS
FREEZING THE BISCUITS
If you’ve frozen the biscuits, take them out and arrange them on a lined baking sheet. Once defrosted, pop them in a medium oven 190C/170 fan/gas mark 5 and heat for 2-3 mins to crisp up. Don’t leave them too long or they’ll dry out.
STORING DOUGH
You can keep the uncooked dough in a sealed container in the fridge for up to two weeks. Simply take some out, dollop on a lined baking tray and allow to come up to room temperature for 5 mins before baking

-> STAY AWAY FROM THIS GAME <-
-> NEVER SUPPORT THIS DEVELOPER <-

Your account can be completely randomly banned. And VAC ban will remain on your account labeling you as a cheater even though you're honest player. There is no customer support, only bot giving you copy-paste info, basically telling you that ban is irreversible and asking you for understanding. They won't give you specific reason for ban, just a list of possible reasons, none of which is remotely close to the truth. It's so random that its scary. I can't believe that developer went for this solution and is basically slandering names of honest players that just wanted to check out their game. I'm currently fighting with them, trying to force out this irrational and harmful ban with no effect.

Just for you to have a little background, I'm gamer girl with a few games that I play from time to time with or without my friends. I downloaded PUBG because while I really like DayZ, cheaters there have ruined my experience. My friends asked me to join them and try PUBG, which I did for literally 3 hours and I've menaged to kill just one player. Next day I'm trying to play the game again and I'm banned for cheating (!!!!!) which I personally despise (!!!!!).

Technically speaking, I have very limited amount of software for work and few games on steam. There's no software that could remotely suggest any suspicious behaviour. If photoshop or avast are danger to your game, I guess you should never release it or make games in general.

Therefore I conclude that I was foully punished for something I never did, and I would never do, and now there's a VAC ban plastered on my steam account which just saddens me. What saddens me more is that there is no one to take responsibility for it or could support me in professional manner. Neither steam or developer offer any help, including providing reason why I was banned. 

Don't be fooled by F2P, never support this developer and their future games.

It was a fun game. The gun-play is wicked and squirrel-y, but occasionally slow compared to other BR type games. PUBG has plenty of guns and loadouts to build with most maps being interesting to play on, no two games are alike. Charming, but not playful, sticks to the down and dirty gritty roots, mostly.

But remember, that's past-tense because I haven't been able to actually play the game in weeks. There has been an unidentifiable condition where the software package for this game renders as un-playable and crashes unexpectedly, even AFTER deleting the game in full and reinstalling. Crashes used to be once in a blue moon, now I can't open the main menu without being presented a pop-up window stating a crash has happened with the game automatically closing out. I've sent several crash reports to Krafton recently, and over the years and not once seen anything come out of it.

For what it's worth, let's put the Developers on blast here for the fact that they haven't cared about fixing the most common, hard issues with the software (i.e. unexpected crashing, delayed damage, etc.) in years. It's hard to want to be part of community discussions/surveys since they have ignored almost every input by the community and only "fix" the most benign issues or overtly ignored them for gimmicky add-ons and systems nobody uses in-game (mortars and spotter's sight anyone?) to try to lure in new players.

TO KRAFTON, stop adding maps, guns, features and skins for a SINGLE season and FIX the basic things that are plaguing your player base and focus on player retention, not getting new players.

I'll gladly change this rating and edit this review seeing a fix come of this. For now, try another BR and let Krafton feel the struggle until they get their act together.

I know it's probably a little late to expect it, but this game desperately needs matchmaking. You've seen it in so many other reviews, but it cannot be overstated. The preponderance of level 500 players, especially in casual matches, is absurd and it seems like there are more of them in casual matches than regular matches.

The only problem with matchmaking is, since the game is not pay to win, there is nothing stopping elite players from simply creating a new account and starting over as low level player and wiping the map masquerading as an inexperienced player. So I'm not entirely sure what the solution is, but it makes the game incredibly frustrating for those who would otherwise enjoy playing the game casually.

PUBG is, in essence, the original stand-alone battle royale game. It is clunky, difficult to learn, features some of the most punishing gameplay of any BR game, mil-sim style controls, and a somewhat dwindling playerbase in NA.

And yet, it's still easily one of the best BRs on the market. Each of the 9 maps in PUBG feels distinctive, with multiple interesting POIs to play around. The guns all feel very distinct from one another, with unique recoil patterns and behavior; attachments on top of these change the dynamic of each weapon significantly. Vehicles feel weighty to drive and force you (in the case of things like the motorbikes) to drive carefully, unlike games with similar vehicles (looking at you, Fortnite).

Yeah, the game runs kinda like shit. The optimizations over the years have helped but it's certainly held back a bit by the sheer scale of the maps which range from around the size of another BR game like Fortnite or Apex to the size of an Ubisoft/Rockstar open world game. And yeah, the controls are very clunky, deriving primarily from Arma II where this game's predecessor mod existed. But that only ads to the charm of the game, where players move slowly and deliberately and positioning and pre-planning take precedence to the moment to moment action of other top BR titles.

The only true negative for PUBG is its use of BattlEye anti-cheat, an utterly ineffective and easy to bypass system that has allowed more cheaters through than other games with stronger, custom anti-cheat measures like Warzone's Ricochet. Overall, though, the occasional cheater is worth getting to experience the fun this game still has years after its initial launch. Now that it's free to play, there's no excuse for not giving it a shot.

This game is broken, fully hacker not suggest to play.

First the bad:
The game crashes a lot. I mean like it takes 3 tries to even get it going. It used to crash mid-game which is really frustrating, but they seem to have ironed that out. I wonder what programming language they are using. Or why it's happening.

Also, they've gameified the interface so much its hard to know where to click to get what. Very chinese/asian vibes in that regard. There are 3 different crafting areas, two different coins, two different places to buy guns, two ways to get skins, multiple events you have to opt into to get free drops, plus the premium system which you gotta manually click to get rewards plus free drops within that system if you are not premium. A lot of clicking around to understand what is going on. Eventually it mostly makes sense, but it seems unnecessarily convoluted.

However, with that said, the gameplay loop is great. It is challenging, but you do get better. It is realistic enough to feel like a solid accomplishment when you do win. It requires talent, and coordination, and raw skill, and a decent PC. It's fun because it is challenging enough to make you want more. The people playing right now are mostly decent. Occasionally there is an asshole, but generally I have a good time playing with complete strangers. People have mics and everyone tends to try their best.

It's a good 30m to 1h time commitment and then move on..

Between the console and PC versions of this game, I have played 400+ hours of PUBG, starting in 2017. Back then, the console version was not in a good state. DCs in 25% of the games, frame drops, etc. I recently returned to the title on PC, and I can say that performance has vastly improved. I've played over 150 hours in the PC version and have yet to disconnect from a single game. I don't notice any significant framerate lag or other performance issues in game. The new map Deston is, IMHO, their best yet, although Erangel will always be my favorite. They have added new mechanics, new weapons, new gear, and the experience is the best it has ever been. Now is the time for old players to return, and, since the game is free to play, now is the time for new players to dip their toes in. If you are a new player, find some experienced vets to show you the ropes. I have installed and uninstalled this game over the years, but there's something about this game that keeps calling me back.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

This game saved my life.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiralling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

I support and cherish all people who played the OG PUBG during the summer of 2018. For it was the best time anybody could've experienced this game, and this is not just some old-school novelty nostalgia. At its current state, the game has been overrun by mountains of over-saturated content in update race wars with Fortnite, Apex, Warzone, and many more. It's not the developer's fault for adding in things, but rather a distasteful fact. The fact that this game does not respect your time, and you shouldn't either. For every new shiny toy, a skin, a season, and a questionable gameplay decision added in, it is another moment to reflect and reconsider playing this game by yourself or with friends. Games are art, meant to evoke interest, curiosity, and most important of all, fun. This is not a game, this is a sellout money-making machine.

Honestly, this game is addicting, but I can't really say it's FUN.  I've played for 387 hours over the last couple of years, and I'm still terrible at it.  The games are dominated by really high-level players, and there is no skill-based matchmaking, so a typical game is spending 10 minutes running around gathering loot, then 5 minutse running from the circle, and then dying from someone you never saw.  Rinse and repeat.

It's fun to jump in a game with friends and mess around, but I can't say I'd recommend this game to a new player, unless you're already well-versed in battle-royale type games and good at them.

I have wasted something close to 1400 hours in this game desperately trying to "get good". But after all that time, watching every streamer or youtuber who could offer any instruction, playing with the best players I could hook up with in order to learn from them, practicing in TDM and the training mode, and doing just about everything I could to improve my game, paying for better hardware and better internet, hours researching and tinkering with my settings, on and on, I have finally come to the conclusion that it isn't me, it's the game. 

I outsmart other players, surprise them, outgun them, shoot first and hit my headshots, and they don't go down. I put sniper round after sniper round right square in their faces and they don't go down. Hit shot after shot at close range with shotguns and they don't go down.

The final straw came today when I hot dropped, got a beryl, and fired half the magazine into the chest of a totally unarmored foe, blood spray just about blockign my view, and he didn't go down. He walked right up to me while I put bullets in his chest and punched me out.

This game is broken. No other game performs this poorly for me, not even the little crowdfunded goofy shooter games. Massive desync and non-reg all day, every day. This game sucks and the developers are far more concerned with dropping new maps and game-breaking items (blue chip detector anyone?) than they are with fixing game performance. Too much of my life has gone into this piece of shit and it is way past time for me to uninstall it and move on to something else.

PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds (PUBG) is a poorly designed and executed battle royale game that is plagued by technical issues and is far too reliant on luck to be enjoyable.

The game's map is bland and uninspired, the gunplay is floaty and inaccurate, and the game is plagued by technical issues such as server lag, rubber banding, and crashes.

The game's biggest problem is its complete reliance on luck. The game's loot system is RNG-based, meaning that players have no control over what weapons and items they will find. This often leads to players being completely outmatched and unable to win fights, regardless of their skill level.

The game is also poorly designed and is need of a major rework. The UI is cluttered and confusing, the game's menus are confusing and difficult to navigate, and the game lacks any sort of tutorial or onboarding to help new players understand how to play.

Overall, PUBG is a poorly designed, buggy, and luck-based battle royale game that is not worth your time.

If I may add some more suggestions as to what I personally believe would be nice to add:

1) Option to chat with other characters (at least the main ones) which could affect how they feel about me.

2) The chance to experience multiple endings based on actions taken during the game.

3) An option to kiss or cuddle during sex. I mean...its nice if there is an option to be a bit romantic too. In fact why not add even a modicum of romance to the player if one is interested in pursuing it?

4) The chance to play "voyeur" to other characters having sex and see them talking during sex. Maybe even join them.

5) The game seems to have a main girl that is behind the events of the game. It would be cool if she got some kind of relationship values that could affect how things would end up with her. Like becoming her sex slave, a casual fling, one of her consorts, make HER into your sex slave, becoming an evil couple in crime, a harem ending for the player or actually getting some loving and romantic relationship (while riding into the sunset).

6) Maybe the chance to get to be a pseudo detective by learning stuff about characters and the events that take place both through conversations and collecting clues? That may help solve some mysteries or manipulate/reveal characters hidden fetishes or agendas?

7) Some/more places with more life around them? Like more characters who live their own life and have some specific schedules (maybe changeable based on the player character's actions)?

8) The chance to avoid fights via dialogue/sex/knowledge about the character with whom one normally would fight?

9) Threesome sex scenes (if they are not there already).

10) Collecting letters/notes that explain better what is going on in the story or about characters in further detail.

11) Chance to interact with characters even outside of sex scenes. Like groping/hugging/kissing someone and have said character react in a specific way depending on their personality or the relationship they have with the player or someone else (like if they are married or in love with someone but the player might with a good deal of effort seduce even such people if doing the right things).

Cheers!

Initially: would not recommend, here's why:

"New PUBG: looks great, sounds great, runs great.

What's the problem?

Lvl 500 player TEAMS matched against lvl 2 randoms.

PUBG: do the right thing, and solve the matchmaking.  Don't just throw any old groups together.  This is why so many games are dying, and why you are not reaching your potential. But getting wiped out by people who have specialised recently in the Beryl for 900 hours since patch vs my 600 hours total since OG days and probably since before half the lvl500s were even born? Now, would recommend, here's why:

"Play with teammates."

What is there left to say about this transformative game that hasn't already been said?  

My favorite aspect of PUBG:BG, and the thing that sets it apart from most other BR games is its pacing.  This is a much slower BR game when compared to Warzone or Apex.  Firefights can last minutes, and involve multiple targets in multiple locations.  

The driving in this game is surprisingly satisfying, and could easily be considered top tier among non driving focused games.

On NA servers this game still holds up today, and with Cheaters becoming a more rare occurrence, one could even argue PUBG is in the best shape of its lifespan.

PUBG as you know it, is a great FPS shooter Battle Royale with realistic gunplay. Do to this, it has steep learning curve but extremely fun to play once you've mastered. A lot of gamers say that the game has lost value after many popular streamers left playing it, which is far from the truth. The thing is PUBG has kept on improving on all its gameplay aspects. One can confidentally say that PUBG is in a better form as it was back in the day. Of course there are bugs and glitches, but which game is free of it. As for new player, it's a great game to play with your friends to unwind the day.

This game started out as a gem. Sure it had goofiness and glitches, but they were manageable. It was extremely fresh and fun with friends. It was a blast. It was a combination of early DayZ and Arma III mechanics. It's now nothing but a cesspool of hackers and toxicity (they had to remove lobby chat awhile ago). Your random teammates will be useless from the beginning. You'll get one-shotted by someone who automatically snaps onto you in the killcam from a random building or location several hundred meters away. Don't even get me started on the bots. It has been overloaded with absolute cringe skins that are astronomically priced in the store. Thumbnails of items never reflect what's actually in the store most of the time. Also, what's with the random Assassin's Creed and Nier Automata skins? The random battle points (original) packs are worthless and the chance of getting anything remotely cool looking is near zero. This game did not need to jump on the season/battlepass/microtransaction bandwagon that it so graciously has. It'll eventually die off as it should've a long time ago.

I played PubG when it first launched. Put it down for the past 1.5 yrs. Had some friends recently pick it back up, so today, august 8th 2022 I decided to boot it up again. Although I have almost 1000 hrs between xbox and pc, the game required me to play the training. Nothing aside from a few new guns/equipment have been added, yet I was forced to spend an hour of my day killing bots, and doing things that I already knew how to do, such as throw a grenade, or drink a redbull. After wasting my time I finally unlock the ability to play the game only to find out that they removed duos, and my buddy and I cannot play... Used to be a great game. Now its trash. Not sure who is calling the shots now, but they obviously do not know or appreciate the original fan base. Dont waste your time

This game is not for the faint-hearted. I've been playing PubG since it was in alpha stages so over 5 years now just about. That being said it has it's flaws but the devs have put some efforts into making it a better experience albeit they've taken mechanics from other games and implemented it into their own without infringing upon copyrights and I respect that. 
This is one of the very few 3rd person perspective battle royales out there that helped create the genre and then they had issues being able to get set up for competitive play so they just locked the FPP view and said "hey we have fpp, let us make more money by having pro gaming on it."
     End of the day on this its a third person game, if you can't play it in that view by all means go fpp but you're just limiting yourself. The community is still fairly large but toxic at times as FPP players always hate on TPP players cus they lack the knowledge and aptitude of realizing this game was actually made for TPP originally and try to act like they're better than you.
     The biggest flaw this game has is that it doesn't have its own anti-cheat and there are hackers, an abundance of them at that. Just spectate and report them. If you have a good squad and people that can work together you can still potentially kill the hackers but only if you third party and pick them off since they can either see you with esp or just insta-lock onto you with an aimbot. 
     Ultimately they still suck cus they have to use such exploits to simulate they're good at the game or just to piss other people off. If you have a good group of friends that communicate well and can use proper strategies this game is fun even if it still pisses you off at the same time it still always balances it out.

Since nobody on the PUBG community will read the reviews, I'll say in this review I'm gay and I love cross-dressing as a femboy.

Though I am super late in trying it out. I have enjoyed my experience in the game. 

I like the ability to go prone, crouch, standing. not all games allow that. 
I really like the way this game can seem to blend the benefits of using both first and third person. Though I do not mind playing first person locked games at all. I really do enjoy the mix of first and third person found in casual mode. Mind you I have no idea of the negatives long term players would probably know of. I really enjoyed the gun selection, though at first I did not understand the modding weapons with addons part very well at first. Within five or so games I understood things pretty well and was comfortable with navigating the inventory. Now I find it quite polished and fluid. Sometimes I find picking up one item that is stacked upon another weapon that you dont want just to have it grab the weapon and throw down your current. thats a bit annoying.. I think the sound is quite excellent. I like the way the bullet snaps over your head, or off the rocks nearby.. The sound is very VERY good. I think my favorite thing in my gameplay so far is how well this game allows the player to use terrain to avoid incoming gunfire. When I played this game I was reminded of a story an ex soldier told me about being able to hid behind a simple roadside curb to avoid incoming fire. Thats how it feels, Like the smarter player can quickly dive into a divit in the ground, follow a ditch or just trying to keep in cover. I enjoy (for now at least) surviving in this game. The simple act of surviving into the top ten still feels very rewarding to me. As does getting a single kill in a match. As a solo player I treat it very much like I am trying to survive in a very hostile place. Sometimes I actively avoid conflict, kite around to the other side of the circle. sit in the blue waiting for people to leave. Maybe none of this is what an experienced player does. But for now it feels great to me. I am not fond of the smaller maps. I find this game is best suited to my tastes with that first really bit map. Though again, long time players would probably disagree. People have told me vaulting and movement is terrible.. I actually would disagree. I find the movement to be fine. and the vaulting is janky if you aproach at shit angles (kinda on you) but reliable headon. Overall I find the game to be very entertaining for now. I got it for free so any mileage is good right? I would not know much about hackers or how bad the issue is in this game. I do see alot of lvl 500 players aims doing some pretty impressive snappy movements onto some very precisely aimed heads. or some insane deathcame autotracking where it seems like the player can see me and is just waiting for me to pop out. or maybe I was just making too much noise cause im new? Who knows. I do know that for now, that is not my concern. Nothing is riding on my winning these games. I dont actually care if I do or not and most times I am just happy to hit the top ten. I am twenty five ours in and still doing a match or two a day so I think this game is doing fine by me. Because I cannot spell reccomend, I suggest that you try this game, or maybe even re visit it as some of the old complaints seem to have been fixed.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories

So, to begin with this, I installed PUBG again to play with a buddy of mine. I played for less than an hour and got off. I had to work that morning. I work the entire weekend and get back on today and noticed that PUBG banned me and also put a VAC on my steam account. I contacted support and they explained that there may be a software (how am I suppose to know which software) on my computer even though that it does not have to do with hacking and or cheating that goes against guidelines. I'm a full time police officer and I play games on my days off to relieve stress along with time away. I simply explained to them that they need to create some sort of document writing down every single program there is that goes against their guidelines so people in the future along with myself will know. I have never in my years of living cheat/hacked, nor downloaded any sort of programs that would change or effect the gameplay. Below is what the original response from PUBG support - 
It looks like you are writing about a restricted account.

We understand that this may be a very frustrating experience. However, please understand that a restriction is placed because we have determined that there was a violation of our terms and services and is permanently restricted. Your account has been banned on 2022-07-31 23:41:10 KST and the process cannot be reversed.
 
Please note that even without having any programs specifically for “hacking/cheating” there are other programs or actions that can violate our Rules of Conduct and cause a permanent restriction.
 
- Software that bypasses the services in the game
- Programs that alter the game in any way (even if it is not for cheating)
- Cheats, macros, etc, for other games and not for PUBG, is still a violation of the game’s services.

If you'd like to spend 30 minutes looting, just to get 1 shot cross map and have absolutely no clue who killed you, download this game.

 If you'd like to sit in 1 spot for 45 minutes without doing anything even remotely fun, download this game.

If you're sick of sweaty games like warzone, apex, fortnite, etc. then don't bother with this game, it's the exact same. The audio is atrocious, the matchmaking is atrocious, the flight system is atrocious, the fact that you have to reload a gun immediately after picking it up off drop is ridiculous, the cross compatibility with controller is brutal(just play KBM), graphics are  like xbox 360 cod graphics (potentially worse tbh).

PUBG is a game about surviving on a quickly shrinking map with other 60-99 players. The game has around 6 different maps which differ in size and theme. 
There are 2 modes of playing:
- TPP which is the 3rd person shooter mode
- FPP which is the 1st person shooter mode (I recommend this one, it's much more dynamic)
The main goal of the game is surviving until you're the last team on the map alive. But to achieve this goal you should go through a several steps plan:
1. Pick a location where to jump from the plane
2. Search for weapons and equipment
3. Try to avoid the blue zone since it damages you
4. Pick good spots to kill other players and avoid being targeted

The game is full of running around from a location to another because the map is huge even for 100 players. The odds are that you'll rarely get past 5 kills because encounters aren't that frequent. The good part is that you're always in a kind of tension whether you'll find a player around the corner or whether the footsteps that you hear are of your teammate or an enemy.  
You'll miss a lot of kills in this game because the shooting is pretty realistic, weapons having different bullet speeds, bullets dealing less damage over greater distances, the bullets flying in a curved trajectory (especially for VSS which is a real bitch when shooting at distances over 200m)
There's also weapon upgrades and different miscellaneous items like drones, spike traps, C4 etc.
For the fans of survival shooters(or team shooters in general) recommended.

Great 'battle royale' shooter, that is unfortunately riddled with cheaters. (There are simple systems in place to report cheaters, but the post replay system shows considerably different from in game scenarios and death cam replays, so keep this in mind before reporting people as a knee-jerk reaction to getting slaughtered.

At present, we (South Africans) have a high ping and de-sync rate, as all servers are over-seas which leaves us vulnerable in close quarter situations. Anything under 50m and you're chances of getting murdered without mercy increase exponentially, which is a shame, because we'd probably give the international community a proper spanking with lower pings.

The maps are great, the spawning is alright, sometimes it's in your favour, and sometimes you're left wondering where it is, so the randomness of this mechanic is great. Some spots are better than others, and the Pro's/Level 500 players know it like the back of their hands, if not better.

Ultimately the game is really about 'luck of the draw' with a dash (or two) of skill. As long as you don't get hung up on having to loot and run quite a bit before getting some shots off, you'll enjoy this title. (Depending if you throw yourselves into the "crucible of fire" or not).  It can get frustrating at times (especially with some of the players that blatantly cheat) but you're not playing for those moments... You're chasing that Chicken dinner... and when you get it... It makes all the "getting murdered" so worth it.

Don't pay attention to the repeated dying and you'll be just fine with this game, enjoy the 'run and gun' of it all, skill up, get better, and for gawd's sake don't let the cheaters get the better of you... 

Hope to see you on the battlefields soon...

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Hundreds of players land on a huge map: with fields, forests, towns, villages, single houses and bridges. The route of the plane on which we arrive is different each time, and you can choose the moment for the jump yourself. We don’t have equipment: armour, weapons, first-aid kits, body kits for guns – everything needs to be looked for on the level, searching through the houses. Over time, an area is allocated on the map, which is gradually shrinking, all players outside it die rather quickly. The goal is to survive. Only one will remain. It's that simple.

Iv been playing this game since 2018 and have over 1000 hrs+.
 I have to say that random map pool locked is the worse choise pubg devs made. For me personally queuing for 10 min just to find a map I want to play is to much. I know that this feature is necessary for matchmaking and finding a game quicker. But hear me out there is still a room for change and making things a little better in this "masterpiece" of game.
Firstly take out tdm and casual mode they were fun at first but now they are kinda just there and just taking a slot in the matchmaking pool also, I personally bought this game for the br experience and not for good old tdm, I know i know its more for the "new players" (if there are any this days) and for warm ups and stuff but for this the practice range exist.

Secondly divide the map pool into 3 sections:
Mini royale: for a fast br experience ( maps like sanhok, karakin, paramo).
And regular br: for a more immersive br experience ( maps like Erangel ,Miramar , Taego ).
And the practice.

After almost 500-hrs I decided  it was a good time to put my review here.

It is a game I enjoy but not enough to play by myself. Scripters, wallhackers, the lack of content( that IT COULD DEFINITELY), and a NA community that I wish was as strong as EU or Asia(ranked in NA is very limited). These are some  reasons why I have put down the game multiple times. My friends are the only reason why I keep playing.

PUBG could be so much more if there was interest from the developers. Add Free-for-all to the arcade, or any other modes, not just team death match. Constant events with  meaningful rewards would keep me more engaged in the game. Or at least skins related to a known team that constantly plays in the torunaments. 

TLDR; Okay game if your friends are good, not enough to keep a loner entertain.

That is the mantra of this game currently it seems because if you want to be sniped or clipped through buildings from an unforeseen enemy that apparently can send a bullet through the front door, up the stairs, around the corner, into the bedroom and straight up the crack of your khakis without any audio warning than this is the game for you! This game was alright for a hot minute but you soon found yourself being sniped by people you will never see and sometimes this is genuine good players, other times it is people shooting through mountains! Server issues were present but not overbearing, matchmaking was relatively quick but the pacing of each match would either be a short burst of violence early on or dropping into abandoned territory and looting for an eternity, running marathons to find players and then getting sniped or engaging in a trade-off with some speck in the distance. It becomes old fast and to be honest there are much better games out now that this becomes a chore to play, so for that reason I am outta here! Good luck if you still play this!

About the game: This game is perhaps... the first significant battle royale (royal battle) since the rise of the genre.  The temptation of the general concept, the cheerfulness of the gameplay in the first couple, lured a huge number of people to conquer and survive, among others, in restricted areas.  The developers had it all: the fame, the money, the media attention and the opportunities that came with it.  What did the developers of the game do with fallen happiness?  No, they didn’t polish the game to perfection so that people wouldn’t be afraid to crash out of the game or not load into the match at all, they didn’t fix the crooked animation and general outdated graphics (hello, the plane that still “throws out” people through a closed cargo hold  ), did not work for the community in such a way that even free players would have a sense to get something from the battle pass, where only a fig is in store for them, and even then without oil.  As a result, we only have that over the past years they have diligently filled the store with donated items, sold half-empty passes, and sometimes pleased with a new map or a fresh patch, that's all.  They could still compete in popularity with the late fortnite-ohm, only if they didn’t try to immediately extract all the money from the players, forgetting to work on bugs, but diligently engaged in improving the quality of the product to modern industry standards.  Only with a stretch this review will have a recommendatory character, because with all the residual pleasantness, being in a campaign of friends, from spending time in the game, it is impossible to close your eyes to a huge number of flaws, disregard for those who did not bring it and just to those who are thirsty for a decent  product to the players.
 Strengths:
 + Pleasant, realistic style of the environment
 + Detailed character models
 + Acceptable range of weapons and vehicles
 + In the campaign of friends, quite peppy gameplay, if you do not start farming in the mode with bots
 + Not bad music in the main menu (includes all tracks from the very release of the game)
 + A huge number of skins for the character and weapons... just either pay a lot or collect for years :)
 + Low product price until the end of 2021, free from 2022
 Weak sides:
 - Noticeably outdated level of graphics and animation of objects
 - Curvature of control at the level of old games
 - Poor optimization with the possibility of a crash during a match
 - Extremely poor battle pass

Lets face it. PUBG is the worst Battle Royale on the market. From the numerous bugs/glitches, the god awful servers, clunky character movements, it is really no mystery why this game barely breaks even for player satisfaction. No skill based matchmaking, squads don't auto fill or auto balance at all, hackers in roughly 3 of the 5 matches you will play, no real training system to learn the game, and after 19 seasons it is quite obvious that the developers have no interest in making their game playable/enjoyable. But don't worry, give them some money, and you can have a few cosmetic items to make up for the joke that is PUBG. 1/10

This game is overwhelmed by hackers! 
Every second match you go head-to-head against a hacker. Either aim assist or wh or both. 
Yes, you can see the death cam but in-game reporting is broken (in the end of the report a network lag detection error appears for a split second)
. There is a report protection provided by the hack program and hackers can also see when someone is spectating them and "suddenly" they act like dumb noobs. After checking the long replay file you see all the sus activity. 
Only way how to truly report a hacker is trough submitting a ticket, but it means u need to upload a video and this is way too long process. 
Until this issue remains, I don't recommend this game. No fun.

I am genuinely shocked that a game that's been out this long, is so narrowly minded in focus, so afraid of it's player base as to deny them legitimate avenues for enjoyment (i.e. custom zombie bot maps) and so broken with respect to disconnections, that anyone could consider this game 'good.' There is absolute amazing potential with this game, there is no doubt about that - this is in my opinion what people play PUBG for, the theoretical presentation of the game.

Cheaters make Ranked an unfortunate joke. I don't understand how this game cannot compensate players who are killed by players who are banned or even temp banned (ANY suspicion should be enough) to have their lost Ranked points returned or be credited with some amount. Ranked is also complicated by the insane choice to region lock areas and still produce no way for players to have any clear idea as to those who might want to play locally - hence no one in Australia is able to play locally. How could this be solved? Oh, I don't know...maybe an active count / tally that is public so people can see X number of people want to play ranked and are pseudo queued up to play it > compromises can be made as to FPP/TPP though hell, if you are obsessed with your 100 player count (no longer a healthy player base in Australia), why don't you simply compromise?! At 20 players, start a match! Make it a smaller and faster circle situation. There is no way to standardise 100 players in maps anymore. That time is over.

Ranting more about the cheaters, I personally feel sorry for people who want to win at all costs and can literally trick themselves into thinking they've accomplished something by doing so...Though again, this could be solved by allowing players freedom and choice - such as with custom lobbies, managed locally (therefore effectively) to screen for cheaters, with those found cheating, kicked out for good. PUBG cannot reliably implement an anti-cheating system in the face of the money these companies seem to make, so again, with a valid solution available, the decision is to do nothing but release updates with silly new maps and more hollow, click-bait item purchases.

PUBG could be great. It could be. However there is far too much fear and a complete disconnect apparent in terms of what is considered enjoyment vs methods of monetising.

Mixed feelings...
- Very satisfying gunplay, very large maps... exactly what I imagined a battle royale game would be like.
- Casual play (12 players, 88 bots) limited to only 3x per day. Some of us actually want to have fun and not just be shot in the back from someone we can't see 300 metres away.
- Matchmaking and teamwork is all over the place... almost nobody communicates, very few people speak English, German or French. I can never find players who were fun to play with on the Steam community... very strange.
- Less cheating than I expected.

I bought this game in 2018 with only one intention -> to grind solo FPP ranked. There always was and always will be cheaters, but for me the game was amazingly enjoyable. Then, after a year, you removed ranked and added bots to the matchmaking, that completely destroyed this game for me and other solo players. Years later we still don't have a decent BR alternative, you have all the money, online and player's love in the world to bring back this game mode and remove bots with just a few lines of code and I will play this game 24/7. For years now I'm scanning the patch notes for this and developers mercilessly refusing me and others. All I see in patch notes are endless maps, battlepasses, skins, events, that absolutely no one looking forward too. In my entire gaming life this product is the most disappointing and frustrating by far margin...

I have been playing this game since it's release, and I can't bring myself to play for more than 2 matches. The maps are fun, yet the mobility in the game doesn't fit the map sizes. Too many bots in every match make this game seem like its dead. Add respawns after death, or speed up the player movements to match the map sizes. I spend more time looting and walking (driving) around theses big maps, than seeing or even hearing other REAL players. The game devs have been too idle with these visable and yet simple issues. Add a higher total player count for each match to 150 or reduce the map sizes to enable more player v player interactions. This game is on it's last leg, and tbf I hope it does die if these devs don't put some actual work into this game. This is what happens when your mod teams don't play the game as a fan, but rather do it as a job.

- EXTRA INFORMATION -
➼ It can be repetitive as most battle Royale's are and there isn't much variety in the gunfights, but especially since the game was made free-to-play, it's definitely worth downloading if you haven't before! Graphics aren't too much of an issue as lots of people set their graphics to low on a lot of options for increased competitive advantage, in which these setting require very little from a machine. Playing with friends is definitely more fun than alone, which is what I'm basing the experience off of. There's a good enough ratio of winning - losing in public games where it doesn't feel easy but it isn't repetitively difficult every game and you feel like you'll never win.

Happy Hunting!

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

I am a 56 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing PUBG. I am a single father to my Son, who is 15 now. My son recently started playing PUBG. After less than a week, he already had 20 hours of playtime. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account to play with my Son. I started playing, but this was my first time playing a video game since the 90's, so i was quite lost. I asked my Son for help and together we spend hours playing PUBG. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. Steam has ever since brought me and my Son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. PUBG reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.
