I've been playing FPS games since the 90's, aimbot and wallhack have been around since then, and some how miraculously, the dev's at PUBG, despite going to great lengths to publicly enumerate the ways they are combating the problem still can't seem to stop cheaters?
inconsistent unreliable ballistic physics, and I suspect replete with exploits
I went back and looked through various chatrooms, etc, and one of the most consistent complaints I see about this game is that the mechanics are bafflingly inconsistent. The devs have insisted that they are fixing this. They have insisted for 5 years at least. I started playing less than 6 months ago, and I can pretty much spot bad net code, lag, and desync, when I see it... If this is the best they can do after 5 years. Well, my mama always used to say if you can't say nothin nice don't say nothin at all. Actually fuck that. As long as idiots are happy to shell out cash for lame ass vanity crap, the devs I'm sure will happily collect their checks, and not really do anything about it.
Speaking of which, the vanity items in this game, are lame as hell, agonizingly grindy to earn, unless you got lots of disposable income...
In short this game is high risk, low reward, with a bewildering vanity menu system, inconsistent, unreliable fps mechanics, that seem to magically work incredibly well for some and leave others unable to hit the broadside of a barn while being one shot head shotted from 500 yds by a dude jumping off a moving vehicle, (I watch kill cams religiously), but the graphics are good. One day I can play solo against teams, and come in second place, next day, I can't land a point blank shot to save my life. Literally. 
if my wife wasn't obsessed with it, and didn't nag me to play with her and her friends, i would never touch this game again, it is so inconsistent. Which is really sad, I wanted to like this game. Alot. I wrote to customer support, and voiced my concerns. They actually replied. Shockingly. I felt it was a well written reply until I went back and looked at past criticisms of the game, then I realized it was copy pasted from responding to the same criticisms for the last five years or so...

I am a 40 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 13 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

If you are a regular casual player or you have never played pubg before then this will be a great place to suffer. The game has two game modes from 3rd person and from 1st person, both options are shit, if you play from 3rd person you will be greeted by a bunch of newbies with with which you can compete, but there are also level 500 players who use the possibilities of 3rd person to the maximum and will rat you, so you will not be able to visit locations like bootcamp, school, hacienda and not be killed by another rat that looks out for you 3rd person. In the game from 1 person, the situation is different but not better, here you will be destroyed by crowds of experienced level 500 players who know every millimeter and the features of the game. And if you still want to play it, then you will have to suffer a lot and become the same nerd as most in this game.
Also, people are talking about cheaters, but I can’t say anything because it’s honestly difficult for me to distinguish a pro player from a cheater.

I have many hours in this game and it has honestly been very fun to play with my friends mainly Vinny and Rocco and Justin and other friends of course but those are just the ones I can remember I like to do challenges like pistols only or no armor and stuff like that and go around the map on the outermost road in each map but its pretty cool to play I don't play it as much as I used to but I still come back to it with my friends all the time and it is really fun to run squads and stuff and each time I come back I think I get better so I like to keep playing it I also have bought some skins in the game for my guns and most of them are pretty cool and I also have spent a lot to make my character look really cool and I think I did a good job but yeah my friends also buy cool items for their characters but I think mine looks the most pretty and handsome I recommend this game for having lots of fun also I bought this game when it wasn't free and I hope that the game stays as it has been because it keeps being fun also I forgot to say that I hit a 500m headshot with the Kar-98k on the asian map idk what its called im not trying to be racist but it was by the bridge and the person was on the other side of the bridge on the land and I was near the water I really like that map but I don't like the snow map that much and the jungle one is okay but only when we all are able to land at Bootcamp but my favorite is definitely Miramar because its a big map and there is cool landscapes and a bunch of other stuff there are also really cool cars arguably the best cars because they go really fast and I also found the super cool golden drug lord car in that cave that I literally had never heard about before but I think there might still be one in the mansion on the hill I forget what its called but regardless of that map I very much enjoy the Erangle map and i like dropping at the apartments near school because it's always very eventful and the map is just really fun I don't have much to say about it despite it being a really cool map and tied for my favorite but my friends favorite map is the small desert map that has the airstrikes that turn the map purple and it destroys houses I like it because there are no cars and its hard to get certain guns and it's much more fast paced but I like that for PVP so yeah to recap there are a lot of things I like about the game and not a lot of things I don't like about the game and now the game is free so there is no reason not to get the game because it's pretty damn good thanks for reading.

This game saved my life.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

the email exchange with their support:
***

Hi
Yesterday I tried closing steam.exe while in a match, this crashed the game and closed it as well and I got banned from the game
I've read all the terms and rules and I believe I have not violated any of them
I did not have any cheating software on my PC or anything that alters the gameplay or bypasses its services, at the time or in the past
I did not violate any of the other terms as well

I would like to know why have I been banned, otherwise please unban my account
Thank you, have a nice day

***

Hello Survivor,

Thank you for contacting PUBG support.

It looks like you are writing about a restricted account.

We understand that this may be a very frustrating experience. However, please understand that a restriction is placed because we have determined that there was a violation of our terms and services, and is permanently restricted. Your account was banned on 2022-08-29 at 21:30:37 UTC and the process cannot be reversed.

Please note that even without having any programs specifically for “hacking/cheating” there are other programs or actions that can violate our Rules of Conduct and cause a permanent restriction.

- Software that bypasses the services in the game

- Programs that alter the game in any way (even if it is not for cheating)

- Cheats, macros, etc, for other games and not for PUBG is still a violation of the game’s services.

We're always available here to assist our players. Please let us know if you have any other feedback, questions, or comments. We will be happy to assist you in any way we can.

PUBG: BATTLEGROUNDS
NOT JUST A GAME, THIS IS BATTLE ROYALE

***

Hello again
Thank you for responding

I don't believe any of the software I had on violates PUBG's rules of conduct
What I had on is as it follows:
Kaspersky AV, Steam, Spotify, Task Manager, and Discord
None one of these programs bypasses the services in the game, alters the game in any way, or is cheats/macros

I believe PUBG's anticheat system thought closing PUBG by closing the steam client was a cheating attempt
If that's not the case, please let me know what exactly has caused the issue

***

Hello Survivor,

Thank you for writing to PUBG Support.

It looks like you are writing back about the restriction on your account.

As mentioned previously, there was an infraction detected in-game and the account has been restricted.

Violations of the terms and services do not just include cheating/hacking programs but also any programs that alter, bypass, or modify the game or its services in any way (even if it is used for non-cheating reasons).

We understand that this is an unfortunate situation and we apologize for the frustration, but there is nothing more we can do to assist with this restriction.

We ask for your understanding of the situation and we hope to provide a better gaming environment for all our players.

PUBG: BATTLEGROUNDS
NOT JUST A GAME, THIS IS BATTLE ROYALE

Hi Robert
Can you please check what was the infraction exactly? As in what was the software that has caused it or what was detected in-game?
I have no software that does what you've mentioned and I still believe my account restriction was unreasonable and a false-flag by PUBG's anticheat system

***

Hello Survivor,

Thank you for writing to PUBG Support.

You have updated us on the previous inquiry about the restriction.

We have already provided you with all the details that we can about the situation. The account has violated the terms and services and is permanently restricted.

We do not provide specific details on what triggered the violation due to security reasons. We do not provide any retests of restrictions since it is being done internally. We have no other information or details that we can provide to you about this situation.

Please refrain from sending multiple tickets on the same subject. If you continue to submit the same ticket continuously, we will have to categorize this as an abuse of our support system and cease any future assistance.

((what a bruh moment))

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

This game could have been great! Yet, the issues that plague this game have been ignored for years making it a game with some great elements but completely ruined by an apathetic or incompetent management/dev team. First, the replay system reflects how things 'sorta' happened. It's so poor you can't tell if someone's cheating when you watch a "replay" as recoil and aiming as portrayed by the 'replay' system is a figment of what actually happened. This leads me to the second major issue for this game -- cheaters. This game is plagued with cheaters and thanks to the 'replay' system you get gaslit into questioning yourself whether the guy who got you was cheating or just legitimately that good. But, after playing the game enough you soon realize that the majority of level 500 players are cheating - using recoil and/or aim hacks. My personal opinion is that this issue has gone unaddressed for so long that if the management/dev team were to address it, it would have to ban more than half its players, thus undermining the number of players that actively play the game. Therefore, the management/devs do nothing to 'save face'.
I look forward to the day where this game is sold off and fixed, or dead -- replaced by a solid product that is A)responsive to legitimate community feedback and B)actively addresses cheating. The years that PUBG has existed with flaccid responses to both illustrate it has utterly failed at both.

Ingredients;

1 cup white sugar
½ cup unsalted butter
2 large eggs
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
1 ¾ teaspoons baking powder
½ cup milk

Directions
Step 1
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9-inch square cake pan.

Step 2
Cream sugar and butter together in a mixing bowl. Add eggs, one at a time, beating briefly after each addition. Stir in vanilla.

Step 3
Combine flour and baking powder in a separate bowl. Add to the wet ingredients and mix well. Add milk and stir until smooth. Pour batter into the prepared cake pan.

Step 4
Bake in the preheated oven until the top springs back when lightly touched, 30 to 40 minutes.

After playing this game way back in its early days, I was a huge fan. I came back to this game for a second chance, but OH MY GOD IT WAS A MISTAKE! DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME! This game is a cess pool of hackers, facebook tv cheaters, and the worst scum to walk the Earth. I genuinely HATE this game now. Devs, you have failed, you money grubbing whores.

The training said, "complete this training to unlock all game modes". I did, did not unlock ranked. Instead you need to play a bunch of casual I guess to unlock? This is also frustratingly unclear if you have no one to explain the game. You need to get to lvl 80 to play ranked, but it appears onlyCcasual levels that up. You are limited to 3 casual matches a day, not in your time zone but like the UTC... I understand this is to prevent hackers entering ranked, and am totally cool for it. But 1 don't lie, and 2 explain it... I'm wasting time playing "random map" game mode. So I guess I have to wait about 4 days at this rate to truly play all game modes, while needing to add tones of hours. 

That all being said, game play is fun, the first of its kind, but the game on the surface appears as an unprofessional MTX game if you ask me. Can't find my answers anywhere online. If someone actually knows and wouldn't mind shooting me a comment/message that'd be great actually. Is there a way besides Casual to level up survivor rank?

Just recently revisited this game after not playing it for a couple of years and I have to say that this game's fall from grace is a sadder sight than I've seen in almost any other game.

To keep it as brief as possible, the devs have lost all touch with's community in terms of what's right for the game and what people actually want; clearly emphasised with it's mixed review state that I have no doubt will be permanent with the state it's in.

My personal quarrels with the changes made to this game over the years are things like the fact that you can no longer select what map you want to play in the main menu, the ranking system is useless if I'm in Bronze tier and I'm still getting matched against level 500 people who play like they are in Grandmaster tier, the silent / obvious cheaters that you can still encounter in matches (whether they are using a wallhack or aimbot, you'll just know by their snappy aim) and the bullshit hit-registration / damage localisation where someone wearing a Level 2 helmet can survive a SAIGA-12 shot to the head?

These are just a few of many problems I can see with the game in it's current state and to think that the developers can't seem to comprehend what's wrong and improve upon these things and instead give the strangest and arbitrary reasonings for them being implemented and changed to begin with. 

Don't waste your bandwidth and time on this game, it's truly not the game it once was and it's hardly worth it anymore.

The basic mechanics on the other hand are quite easy to master.

There's no point in trying to get good because you're just gonna get slapped by level 500 players, there is no skill-based matchmaking whatsoever. You are always at a disadvantage if you don't have any game sense past picking up a weapon. I'm level 50 with only a few wins under my belt because every encounter is some dude deleting me from across the desert with a M24 that i'd never see coming. Also, the death cam is trash and you'd never know if you died because the other player was cheating and snapped to you, or if the replay is lagging and he followed you the whole time. If you wanna try and get better aim on mouse and keyboard, just play CS:GO. At least the silvers are garbage and the P90 is a noob's dream. If you want a battle royale, play Warzone where you're guaranteed people are cheating but it's still Call of Duty. And if you want something realistic, go join the army -- at least you don't get head-glitched by the Taliban.

I am a 44 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 12 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 20 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. We played all night after I got home from my 9-5 day job. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I am a 49 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my son many happy memories.

Anyways, the game is a hackfest, since it was made free. Almost every unranked game is ruined by cheaters. The Best Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookies
Ingredients
for 12 cookies

½ cup granulated sugar(100 g)
¾ cup brown sugar(165 g), packed
1 teaspoon salt
½ cup unsalted butter(115 g), melted
1 egg
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 ¼ cups all-purpose flour(155 g)
½ teaspoon baking soda
4 oz milk or semi-sweet chocolate chunks(110 g)
4 oz dark chocolate chunk(110 g), or your preference
Preparation
1.In a large bowl, whisk together the sugars, salt, and butter until a paste forms with no lumps.
2.Whisk in the egg and vanilla, beating until light ribbons fall off the whisk and remain for a short while before falling back into the mixture.
3.Sift in the flour and baking soda, then fold the mixture with a spatula (Be careful not to overmix, which would cause the gluten in the flour to toughen resulting in cakier cookies).
4.Fold in the chocolate chunks, then chill the dough for at least 30 minutes. For a more intense toffee-like flavor and deeper color, chill the dough overnight. The longer the dough rests, the more complex its flavor will be.
5.Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
6.Scoop the dough with an ice-cream scoop onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet, leaving at least 4 inches (10 cm) of space between cookies and 2 inches (5 cm) of space from the edges of the pan so that the cookies can spread evenly.
7.Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the edges have started to barely brown.
8.Cool completely before serving.
Enjoy!

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Played it for 25hrs and i can say its good game,but its not for my taste(im not competition gamer by any stretch of a imagination).Community is ok,love many weapons that this game has and i respect the fact that this game has good graphics(at least for time when it got released);its great that microtransactions in this game are at minimum(you can buy everything with 2 currencies,but if you don`t want to wait you can use real money),also very important:it works good even on PC/laptop that isn`t suitable for it(i have new laptop with Ryzen 5 5500u,integrated graphic and 24gb ram,it works fine even on medium-high options).What i don`t like is how game (sometimes) gets a bit buggy(acts wierd) to certain mouse and keyboard configurations(i have white shark marcus 2 mouse and it gets imposible to play the game when i set mouse to higher DPI), i also don`t like how main menu is set up(its all over the place and bit confusing).So basicaly: if you have what it takes to play against guys that play this game 12hrs every day for 2yrs even if you don`t have such a hardware;just hoop in and get that chicken dinner.

RU:
Если не рассматривать эту игру как стратегию и (или) шутер, то эта игра - отличное место для совместного время препровождения с друзьями, где можно повеселиться. Но если рассматривать эту игру как стратегическую, то вы столкнётесь с множеством кемперов, которые объясняют своё поведение тактическим подходом; с этой стороны игра требует к себе серьёзного подхода, начиная от тренировок стратегий и заканчивая стрельбой.
ENG:
If you do not consider this game as a strategy and / or shooter, then this game is a great place to spend time together with friends, where you can have fun. But if we consider this game as a strategic one, then you will encounter a lot of campers who explain their behavior with a tactical approach; from this side, the game requires a serious approach, starting from strategy training and ending with shooting.

Отзывы никто не читает, поэтому напишу рецепт овощного салата с тунцом
Продукты (на 2 порции)
Тунец, консервированный в собственном соку - 1 банка
Помидоры черри - 5-6 шт.
Яйцо куриное - 2 шт.
Лук белый - 1 шт.
Огурец большой - 1 шт.
Масло оливковое - 2 ст. ложки
Салат листовой - 100 г
Петрушка - пару веточек
Соль - по вкусу
Перец черный молотый - по вкусу

Для приготовления овощного салата с тунцом подготовьте все необходимые продукты. Овощи помойте, обсушите, слейте воду с тунца. Яйца отварите 8 минут, сразу остудите в холодной воде.

Чистые салатные листья выложите в удобную посуду, заправьте оливковым маслом, солью и перцем, перемешайте.

Выложите салатные листья на блюдо для подачи.

В центр выложите кусочки консервированного тунца в собственном соку.

Нарежьте помидоры черри, выложите их на салат.

Следующим нарежьте огурец, добавьте в салат.


Аккуратно разрежьте яйцо на четыре части, выложите на салат, сбрызните его немного оливковым маслом, посолите и поперчите. Украсьте листиками петрушки.

Посыпьте верх салата кружочками сладкого белого лука.

Подавайте вкуснейший, легкий и полезный овощной салат с тунцом сразу же после приготовления.

I like the game play.  Enjoy the challenge.  Love those rare occasions when I get a good result.  I've had 268 hours of mostly fun gameplay.

So why don't I recommend the game.

In it's current state this game is as stable as dog shit.  Having a good game?  Having a bad game?  PUBG don't care it will randomly crash without any warning.  Nothing is more frustrating than being in the final endgame and having the whole game freeze on you before it then reboots your PC.

Check drivers they say, check file integrity, re-install that game.  Done all this, it makes no difference.  

So then the finger is pointed at my system "you've got a dodgy graphics card mate" is what they say.  Well if that's the case why is this the only game I have that behaves like this?  Why are lots of gamers reporting the same problem?  Why are high profile streamers complaining of the same issue?

In short, the game is good.  The code is pure dog shit.

I love this game, but I can't recommend it to those who want to play it for the first time.

 The game lacks the correct selection of players, both in regular matches and in ranked ones.  For example, you are level 50-100, do you think you will be matched with players of the same level as you, or a maximum of 200-250?  Hah, no!  In most matches, you will come across players of the maximum level who gave their lives to this game!  The only thing you can do in this case is to jump to where there are no players and then hide from everyone all the time, and eventually reach the top 20-30 and die from level 500.  Very fun and interesting right?  And even more interesting is that you will not be able to choose which map to play on, 7 out of 10 fights you will play on Miramar, where there are only open fields, and one fine moment, when you once again run across the open field, you will be killed and you  You don't even know where!
 But instead of changing the matchmaking system, the developers would rather add another new map on which you can never play.  Or even better, they will add new skins, you really need them, right?

 For developers, how to fix the game:
 1 - if you can't make a selection according to the skill of the players, then at least make sure that a level 100 player plays a maximum against a level 200, a level 200 player plays a maximum against a 300. I think this is not difficult to do.
 2 - Give me a choice on which map to play!  I am ready to choose a PARAMO card and wait 3-4 minutes for the players to gather.  I DON'T WANT MIRAMAR, I DON'T WANT!!!  Or you could do this, don't give me a direct map selection, but when the game is ready to load me into combat, ask me "do I want to play the map...MIRAMAR!"  If I press NO, then the game continues to match players, but on any other map.

I will gladly change my comment after the developers somehow change these two points.

Kui otsite selle mängu kohta arvustust, olete sattunud valesse kohta, aga kui otsite silmapaistvat pirukaretsepti, olete jõudnud õigesse kohta.

Koostis:

1. 6 spl soolata võid
2. 1/2 tassi valget suhkrut
3. 1/2 tassi pruuni suhkrut
4. 1/4 tassi vett
5. 1/4 tl kaneeli
6. 1 näputäis soola
7. 5 õuna – kooritud, südamik ja viilutatud
8. 1 küpsetis kahekordse koorega piruka jaoks

Juhised:

1. Kuumuta ahi temperatuurini 425 kraadi F (220 kraadi C).
2. Sega või, valge suhkur, pruun suhkur, vesi, kaneel ja sool kastrulis keskmisel kuumusel. Kuumuta keemiseni, tõsta tulelt ja tõsta kõrvale.
3. Rulli pool tainast lahti, et see mahuks 9-tollise pirukaplaadiga. Asetage alumine koorik pirukaplaadile; vala sisse õunaviilud.
4. Rulli pealmine koor 10-tolliseks ringiks. Lõika terava koorimisnoa või kondiitrikettaga 8 (1-tolliseks) laiaks ribaks. Koo kondiitriribad ükshaaval võremustriks. Voldi võre ribade otsad põhjakooriku serva alla ja suru tihendamiseks kokku.
5. Valage või-suhkru segu piruka peale, kattes võre ja laske ülejäänud kastmel läbi kooriku niriseda.
6. Küpseta eelkuumutatud ahjus 15 minutit. Vähendage kuumust 350 kraadini F (175 kraadi C) ja küpsetage veel 35–40 minutit, kuni koorik on kuldpruun, pealmise kooriku karamell on hangunud ja õunatäidis mullitab. Enne viilutamist lase täielikult jahtuda.

To the point: There are plenty of bad games in the world. I've played a lot of them, this is easily top 3 worst of them all. At 95 hours the amount of times that a person can be aim-botted in this absolutely godawful piece of garbage is astonishing. It's unbelievable that people pay money to play this turd. For a combat based game, the actual combat itself is egregious. Buggy game play, choppy frame rates, clunky overall feeling, awkward handling and frustratingly inaccurate combat are a few descriptive terms that still don't adequately convey how terrible this game truly is. Out of 100 "people", 30 of them are robots and of the 70 remaining, probably 10 of those use aimbots or other exploits. The most entertaining part is looting and that's disappointing half the time. To sum it up you sit in a lobby for a few minutes each round, you dive out of a plane and hope nobody lands close to you because while you're looking for a weapon they're somehow fully geared. They kill and send you back to the lobby. This game should be called "Lobby Simulator" Or "Lets Get Aimbotted". I can't even begin to attempt to detail all of the negative experiences in this game. Dedicating one more second playing this absolutely miserable, embarrassment of a joke of a game is beyond absurd. In 95 hours, estimate around 2-4 matches an hour, and estimate that 3/4ths of those were terrible, and you have this abomination; PUBG.

Man this game just does not really hold up that well anymore!... movement feels clunky and slow, the game is basically just a boring walking simulator waiting for things to happen, only to get killed by a minuscule pixel hiding behind one of the million trees in your field of view (or not even in it!! usually from behind!!). A lot of the gun mechanics just feel clunky too, and maybe that's because I don't know how to use them right, but CS:GO is a game with complex gun mechanics and it still manages to make it somewhat fluid and predictable. I haven't played the game a lot since I bought it 2018 on an old account, but I hear that the Chinese hacker problem is STILL going on, according to reviews? Really sucks tbh. This game was the first of its kind, spawning the battle royale genre as we know it for the most part, but ironically this one was the worst of them all. Fortnite and Apex executed it so much better, they are way more fun. Even as a F2P game now, I would still not recommend anyone waste your precious time on this game

This game is genuinely one of the worst games I have ever played. Almost every aspect about this game is frustrating or flat out unnecessary. As a fair beginner to pubg, these issues are glaring and puts me off from playing.
First off, the beginner experience is terrible. Upon starting, you cannot even begin to play PvP until you complete 10 rounds of PvE, which is a whole another chore to grind through. After completing the snooze fest that is the AI matches, you can choose to play with real people. That seems like a relief, you might think, until you realize every single match you are put in consists of bots and lvl 500 sweaty tryhards. The barrier of entry into this game is horrendous because of this nonsensical matchmaking system. Hell, not even alternative gamemodes are spared from this. I tried finding some enjoyment out of the deathmatch gamemode, but its all the same. The same lvl500s plague this side of the game as well. Before you attack me and tell me to "get good", realize that in every successful game, newer players are catered to a beginner experience to help them ease into the game. Its just part of good game design. However, the pubg devs could care less and it shows.
Secondly, the gameplay. There is no other word to describe the gameplay in pubg other than infuriating. The first issue is the map size. The map is just too big. Anyone who plays pubg can agree with this to an extent, even if you are a recurring player. For 100 players, maps this expansive means that half the gameplay involves walking. You do nothing half the game because there IS nothing to do. This game is basically walking/driving simulator because you cannot even find someone to fight. Also, the fights are just confusing. The game color palette is dark and grimy and this wouldnt be a problem if other players also have the same colors for clothes. This makes finding anyone on the map feel like finding a needle in a haystack. If you squint really closely and look, you might find something moving. But it will turn out to be a piece of paper in the wind. To add on, gunfights share the same problem. If you get shot at in this game, good luck trying to find out where the shooter is. There is no bullet lines or damage indicators telling you where you get shot from. There is not even a minimap that shows you the potential locations of players. Basically, this game boils down to whoever shoots first, wins. This is one of the main reasons I choose to quit this game. If the devs cannot provide players with even the slightest QoL changes, it is sign of a bad game. Another gripe I have is the amount of unnecessary and complicated buttons during gameplay. Its almost as if the devs were making combat complicated for the sake of making it complicated. If you dont believe me, there is a hotkey to hold your breath. Yes, hold your breath when shooting to make gunfire steadier. Its these little things that makes the game much more cluttered than it should be.
Lastly, the cosmetics. Why is half of the game's cosmetics so goofy looking? On one hand, the game is gritty and realistic, with combat simulating real life gunfights. On the other hand, there are dudes in dinosaur onesies running around the battlefeild. If the devs are so deadset on making the game as realistic as possible with all the nuainces such as breathholding, why is there such goofy skins in the same game. It sticks out like a sore thumb and clashes with the game's atmosphere. It is almost as if the devs looked at fortnite and how popular it has become and tried taking a leaf out of their book. It just does not fit in.
So basically, yes , the game is bad and the devs could care less. In fact, I bet they made the game free to play after its playerbase began declining. And I can see why. If you are a new player getting into this game, do yourself a favor and dont. Im not kidding when I say fortnite is a miles better game. If you want a fun battle royale game thats forgiving to beginners, choose anything else other than pubg. Fortnite, warzone, even minecraft hunger games. I am truly disappointed in this game.

You better have a squad ready to go if you play this game a lot, cause it amounts to nothing more than discord with gameplay . Only there's lots of other games that provide roughly the same thing but are actually:

- Engaging
- Don't look like garbage
- Aren't riddled with cheaters and bots 
- The physics don't feel as if you're walking on the moon 

If your PC can handle this then you're much better off playing basically any other multiplayer FPS out there. This game has nothing going for it. Nothing. It feels like an AI Generated UE4 project. It [i] looks [/i] like an AI Generated UE4 project. It's a nothing game. The blandest most uninteresting gameplay loop you can imagine. Get loot, drive to town, kill 5 bots, get sniped by hacker, repeat.

There's solace in that. You don't have to take anything seriously, so you can shoot your friends cause they said something in the discord call that pissed you off (may or may not be based on true events). And you have ample time to f*ck around and do dumb stuff because the games take [i] abysmally [/i] long to get going, but at that point you're just creating your own fun instead of having fun with the game.

Wanna play it anyway? Fine, get a friend group and just get drunk, just remember that you could be getting drunk and playing Garry's Mod instead or some other party game which would have the added bonus of not being PUBG

If you're solo and want to play this then may God have mercy on your soul, seriously.

The game has made little-to-no improvements since I played long ago, and what they have implemented haven't been done well. Too many currency systems, controls still seem a bit clunky, and I hear my computer rev up while it attempts to load the map. I have a good PC, and no other game does this.

The addition of a Deathmatch mode was a nice touch, but it didn't do enough to make me want to play again. If you're going to PUBG for Deathmatch though, you're far better off going with Call Of Duty or something like that.

As for the Battle Royale aspect, it's falling short when compared to all the other games out there. Apex and Fortnite seem to be eclipsing PUBG in almost every aspect, as well as consistently adding new things to keep it interesting (and upgrading the things they're doing well already).

Also, instead of using a good anti-cheat software, they decided to go with Wellbia and it's terrible. It installs into your system and will run after you shut down the game, and doesn't uninstall after uninstalling the game (you need to manually do it). It's garbage, and they should be ashamed of themselves.

I would hate to say that it's not worth a try, but it just needs a lot of work before getting a recommendation from me.

I'm glad i didn't pay any money for this game. The gameplay is really nice, and the guns are pretty fun to use. Graphics wise, it isn't as good as some games released around it, but that doesn't really concern me. *However,* the number of level 500 players makes it completely unfair. It's not their fault, but since there is no free matchmaking, I get pummeled most every game.

When paired with players of my own skill level, it's an amazing game. I can usually get a steady streak... until I run into a level 500 (or even level 150). Then, well.. you can guess what happens to my poor level 32 character. It's disappointing that PUBG has failed to implement a level-based match making system in the normal mode.

All in all, the game is fun to play, but the number of experienced players is completely discouraging. I will continue to play PUBG simply because I like its gameplay and weapons system enough to deal with being pummeled in the late game.

For a survival shooting game I don't want to play as someone dressed in a bright green dino costume, but that just comes down to personal preference. I get this isn't a huge issue, but the only thing this game really has to work towards is skins, as there is nothing to unlock that would actually give an upper hand in-game.

It’s been nearly five whole years since the pioneering PlayerUnknown’s Battlegrounds first appeared on Steam and popularized the idea of pitting 100 players against each other until only the best (or last) among them survives. Since then, the original battle royale has been locked in a fight for relevance against the many games it inspired, and only now has it dropped its entry fee and joined the ranks of its free-to-play competition. Now that the novelty has worn off, in some ways PUBG has been left wanting compared to newer and more innovative battle royales, but its unique focus on massive zones and realistic simulation means it hasn’t lost its touch either.

Survival after parachuting into PUBG’s relatively realistic open world requires you to be much stealthier and more deliberately tactical than you would in, say, the run-and-gun style of Fortnite. For example, you might wait for a passing aircraft to drown out your footsteps so you can enter a household undetected, or you might use a smokescreen to distract a squad of enemy players that are pinning you down from a nearby ridge. Firefights are regularly tense and enjoyable, though the wide selection of guns tend to be clunkier to fire than other modern shooters too (even after you’ve modded them with scopes and extended magazines).


What PUBG has in tactics, it lacks in the “gunfeel” that make games like Call of Duty or Apex Legends so enjoyable to play. Weapons are more tolerable to handle in third-person mode, but frustratingly inaccurate unless you switch to first-person or aim down sights. But since movement is clearly designed around third-person play, not to mention you get the ability to peek around corners without poking your head out, first-person mode feels slow by comparison, and the weapons suffer for it. PUBG’s emphasis on realistic bullet physics sets it apart in an interesting way, and it makes sense that hitmarkers are absent by default because PUBG wants to give you as little information as possible to make its fights more intense. But all that also means it’s not nearly as slick as, say, Call of Duty: Warzone.

Third-person play simply feels much better.

Third-person play simply feels much better, and it seems to be because your player model is physically simulated in much the same way as a character from Grand Theft Auto 5 or Red Dead Redemption 2, with a bit more fluidity in movement — so that you aren’t constantly tripping over yourself, but you still feel fragile. It’s a tough balance to strike, but it’s noticeable that you aren’t playing a game that was particularly intended as a first-person shooter when you switch over to first-person mode. Aiming down sights is also just plain stiff in comparison to any proper first-person shooter, especially Call of Duty or Battlefield.

HOW TO KILL A GAME WITH EXTREME POTENTIAL:

1. Create a game that suddenly becomes the most popular online game in the world. (Even with poor optimizations and servers)
2 When online starts to fall - new cards and skins are added. (And not anti-cheat systems and bug fixes with servers)
4. Sell the game to China - Chinese cheaters are coming
5. 80% of players leave the game because of cheaters
6. We turn a blind eye to all the statements about improving the anti-cheat system and using the Season Pass.
8. Add bots.
9. We try the bottom, when even cheaters are tired of shooting at bots and even they leave the game.
10. Turn off the choice of map and game mode.
11. From hopelessness, you can use the game so that at least someone plays.

9. Пробуем дно, когда даже читерам надоело стрелять в ботов и даже они уходят из игры.

Honest review here from a 1st-time player.
This game is boring. 
I understand why this game was something when it was released and why it kicked off the genre but compared even to CS's battle royal it feels old, unpolished, and yes I am going to repeat myself - boring. If you have the power to stay awake and complete the basic training and the AI training then maybe this game is for you. Unfortunately, I couldn't. Yes, I was playing against AI, yes this is usually a major issue, but in my first game I spent just running from the blue field, and in the second AI game (which they force you to do if you didn't drive a car a certain mileage) I died while jumping out of the vehicle (Nice detail but it was enough to make me uninstall it after just 0.7hrs of playtime).

I wanted to play the game, not against bots that can't aim for shit. I'm not complaining about each match being about 20-30 minutes long, but with bots that are boring and don't do much besides miss a ton, it's incredibly boring to me. TO ADD ON TOP OF THAT YOU HAVE TO PLAY THESE MATCHES 10 TIMES meaning before you get into the actual game you have to play 3 hours with bots unless you kill your character right off the bat each match, either way, it's boring. I wanted to kinda have fun playing against players but I didn't. Instead, I went against bots that only knew how to take cover or stand there and shoot at you. What has this game become?

I hadn't played the game in almost 2 years and hop back in, 2nd match i kill two people. Then get banned immediately a minute after killing them. This game has gone to shit since it came out.

This game is genuinely one of the worst games I have ever played. Almost every aspect about this game is frustrating or flat out unnecessary. As a fair beginner to pubg, these issues are glaring and puts me off from playing.
First off, the beginner experience is terrible. Upon starting, you cannot even begin to play PvP until you complete 10 rounds of PvE, which is a whole another chore to grind through. After completing the snooze fest that is the AI matches, you can choose to play with real people. That seems like a relief, you might think, until you realize every single match you are put in consists of bots and lvl 500 sweaty tryhards. The barrier of entry into this game is horrendous because of this nonsensical matchmaking system. Hell, not even alternative gamemodes are spared from this. I tried finding some enjoyment out of the deathmatch gamemode, but its all the same. The same lvl500s plague this side of the game as well. Before you attack me and tell me to "get good", realize that in every successful game, newer players are catered to a beginner experience to help them ease into the game. Its just part of good game design. However, the pubg devs could care less and it shows.
Secondly, the gameplay. There is no other word to describe the gameplay in pubg other than infuriating. The first issue is the map size. The map is just too big. Anyone who plays pubg can agree with this to an extent, even if you are a recurring player. For 100 players, maps this expansive means that half the gameplay involves walking. You do nothing half the game because there IS nothing to do. This game is basically walking/driving simulator because you cannot even find someone to fight. Also, the fights are just confusing. The game color palette is dark and grimy and this wouldnt be a problem if other players also have the same colors for clothes. This makes finding anyone on the map feel like finding a needle in a haystack. If you squint really closely and look, you might find something moving. But it will turn out to be a piece of paper in the wind. To add on, gunfights share the same problem. If you get shot at in this game, good luck trying to find out where the shooter is. There is no bullet lines or damage indicators telling you where you get shot from. There is not even a minimap that shows you the potential locations of players. Basically, this game boils down to whoever shoots first, wins. This is one of the main reasons I choose to quit this game. If the devs cannot provide players with even the slightest QoL changes, it is sign of a bad game. Another gripe I have is the amount of unnecessary and complicated buttons during gameplay. Its almost as if the devs were making combat complicated for the sake of making it complicated. If you dont believe me, there is a hotkey to hold your breath. Yes, hold your breath when shooting to make gunfire steadier. Its these little things that makes the game much more cluttered than it should be. 
Lastly, the cosmetics. Why is half of the game's cosmetics so goofy looking? On one hand, the game is gritty and realistic, with combat simulating real life gunfights. On the other hand, there are dudes in dinosaur onesies running around the battlefeild. If the devs are so deadset on making the game as realistic as possible with all the nuainces such as breathholding, why is there such goofy skins in the same game. It sticks out like a sore thumb and clashes with the game's atmosphere. It is almost as if the devs looked at fortnite and how popular it has become and tried taking a leaf out of their book. It just does not fit in.
So basically, yes , the game is bad and the devs could care less. In fact, I bet they made the game free to play after its playerbase began declining. And I can see why. If you are a new player getting into this game, do yourself a favor and dont. Im not kidding when I say fortnite is a miles better game. If you want a fun battle royale game thats forgiving to beginners, choose anything else other than pubg. Fortnite, warzone, even minecraft hunger games. I am truly disappointed in this game.
I love it but they should work on it to be good

Nothing offers an experience like PUBG. And that's saying a lot. On one hand any other Battle Royale  just makes me want to play PUBG instead. But playing PUBG just leaves me frustrated and annoyed almost every game. The feeling of the game is fantastic. I love it and it's why I keep playing it despite often telling myself I hate the game. No other game offers the same feeling for me. On the other hand it's riddled with bug even 5 years after release and the playerbase is almost entirely nothing but max level try-hards. Me and my friends have been playing the game since it came out and it feels like we haven't improved in a long time. So if we've reached our peak why are we constantly up against player well beyond our skills? It's because of the dwindling player base. It's also why they had to ruin the game by removing third person duos. They're attempting to condense what few players are left into games. But at least they finnaly introduced a casual mode with only 12 players and almost all bots. Finally the fun of PUBG without the annoyance of being killed by yet another lvl 500 player. And to actually have a chance at a Chicken Dinner. But you can only play it 3 times in a 24 hour period. Ok no problem, Lifes busy anyway, and it's rare that my my friend group is together for more than a few hours. Except back to the constant bugs. about 50% of the time one of our friends just won't be able to load into the game. So we have to leave the match. Well that's 1/3 of the games wasted. Screw you I guess. Why not just let us play casual as much as we want? Why restrict the fun to just 3 games? If the try-hards want to play ranked they can. Maybe they could actually get people back if they fixed the game, added more actual content, and stopped focusing so much attention on the cosmetics. They made the game free and then put so much into the cosmetics you can only get by paying. Maybe I'd play more if I could at least get them by playing. And maybe occasionally spend money for some cosmetics. But there's no motivation or reason. All they care about is squeezing what money they can out of their dying game. It's disappointing. My suggestion. Just don't get into it. It'll leave you wanting more at the wasted potential.

Edit:after realizing that the steam discussion is locked so nobody can make more post I've realized the creators just don't care. Not allowed to discuss why the game crashes. Not allowed to ask why they removed thing like Third Person duos basically forcing you to play against teams of 4 as a 2 man quad. Not allowed to make suggestions. I like this game and I want to play it. But after 5 years it's still a mess and the creators appear to actively try to make the game worse and ignore their community.

My 14 year old will not stop playing Fortnite at any given chance. He doesn't want to go to bed, he doesn't want to do his homework, etc.
I picked him up from school the other day and decided to have fun with it. I pulled up in the van, got out, and stood by the passenger door as the school was letting out. The second I saw him come out the door, I yell "HEY JACOB!!" which gets the attention of like 300 kids filing out of the school. I immediately started doing that Fortnite "floss" dance (which I have seen him do), swung it 5 or 6 times, then finished with an epic dab. The crowd responded with a WHOOOOOOAAAAAA and tons of laughter. I then bowed and opened the passenger door like a chauffeur.
When he got in, I said "Man, I tried that Fortnite thing you play and I can see why you like it so much!"
He seems to have played a lot less lately.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

I bought PUBG a year ago and returned it as i thought it was clunky as hell. BUT when it went free to play i gave it another try and have absolutely fallen in love.

I now understand that what i thought was clunky gunplay was actually brilliant.
The game in no way holds your hand in terms of recoil. In CoD when i have a high recoil weapon, i put the highest magnification sight on it as possible as that cuts down on its recoil by an insane ammount. 
you cant do that in pubg. the recoil is the same no matter the sight, which is as it should be.
not once have i gotten a kill by accident in PUBG it is all and only methodical.
So tactical, so great. 
oh and i only play in first person and solo.

I swear to god, i was just in a game where i was like 10th or something. Im really bad at the game so it was amazing for me. Then the game just caps at 8fps... it wasn't using my gpu, i then continue to die the most stupid death, because i couldn't aim with all the lag. 

Prior to this i also had issues like the unknown crash and the startup crash, i managed to resolve (kinda) one but the other persists. the game sometimes crashes on startup but restarting fixes it, The unknown crash also happens but only a few games in (which still isn't good, but better then before).

Overall i recommend you try this game, but also shouldn't. If you get crashes like i do,  just don't. I had to skim through everything just to find out this one program open causes issues.. Fine pubg, i wont use processhacker (harmless utility i know it sounds like its a hacker tool but it isn't, search it up.) Then MSI caused some issues like my god, this is the first game where i had this many issues.

Then the gameplay itself, meh i mean it is good but if you are new you get destroyed. You get fired at? no problem! i will hide behind this rock, only for you to find out they were actually shooting from that direction. 
Running around in the forest sounds fun right? NOPE get headshotted.  etc etc. 

So in short, no but yes i dont really know. The game is fun but i want to survive for 5 min longer without crashes or getting insta killed from god knows where.

PUBG is the OG Battle Royale, and despite having been out five years, it unfortunately feels like it did all of those years ago. The game is a mess from a technical perspective; even after five years, the game still crashes frequently or fails to start. Animations are stiff, the interface is terrible, and the graphics still require you to turn them all the way to low to have a chance of seeing someone hiding in a field or forest. 100 player matches are a thing of the past, now, you can expect to see bots in every lobby to fill up a server due to the dwindling playerbase, and only after you complete a tutorial that does little more than waste your time. The game's saving grace is that the gunplay still feels weighty and winning is still satisfying, but there are far better BRs to play than this.

The game isn’t really enjoyable unless you shell out some serious money for a top quality graphic card ($1K-$2K plus) and monitors.  The millisecond discrepancy between two players is literally the most frustrating thing I’ve ever seen.  I’ve had TOO many instances where I swore I should’ve had instakills and just kills in general and yet the damage score didn't add up.  This is what ultimately convinced me to uninstall this game.

It is very disappointing because this game, to this day, has SO much potential to get even better and become a more enjoyable experience.  Sadly, developers hardly put in any effort to make the game an enjoyable experience.  As opposed to making improvements, making fixes, adjustments, etc, they just throw eye candy at you via cool skins and other useless crap that is actually not cheap.

The shop is an absolute joke (BP is completely useless and needs a revamp).  If you want to spend money on cool skins and what not, just go to the steam market place and spend maybe pennies on the things you want.  You don’t need to spend a fortune on useless stuff unless you’re a streamer whose income relies on content such as PUBG that use these to market their content.

The developers claim to be transparent on things such as bug fixes/tweaks etc.  However, their commentary is MAYBE 50% legitimate with issues mentioned STILL not resolved AND making changes to the game without notifying anybody about them (eg parts of a player are STILL outside of building if they sit in a corner)

This game should now allow players to choose which map to play.  It’s a free game now and have bots that will fill the void if the wait time meets a certain threshold.

MENGHORMATI ORANG TUA

“Hormatilah ayahmu dan ibumu, supaya lanjut umurmu di tanah yang diberikan TUHAN, Allahmu, kepadamu” (Keluaran 20:12)

Kata “hormat” dalam bahasa Ibrani menggunakan kata “kabad” yang secara hurufiah berarti menjadi berat, atau bertambah berat, atau berbobot berat. Pada zaman kuno, sesuatu yang berbobot berat dianggap memiliki nilai yang lebih besar. Sampai hari ini pun harga dari batu dan logam mulia yang dinilai oleh bobot mereka, artinya semakin berat bobot dari suatu batu dan logam mulia maka harganya semakin mahal. Sedangkan untuk orang, yang dinilai adalah bobot keberadaan dan peranan orang tersebut dalam masyarakat dan sesamanya. Semakin berbobot keberadaan dan peranan orang tersebut maka semakin penting dan mulia orang tersebut.

Dalam bacaan kita hari ini menunjukkan bahwa Alkitab mencatat orang tua memiliki bobot yang besar. Para rabi Yahudi kuno mengajarkan bahwa orang tua harus dihormati karena mereka adalah mitranya Allah (God's partner). Mereka bekerja sama dengan Allah untuk adanya seorang anak. Allah adalah pencipta kehidupan, dan orang tua adalah media yang melaluinya TUHAN memilih untuk membawa kehidupan baru ke dalam dunia. Sebab itu, menghormati orang tua bukanlah soal apa yang mereka sudah lakukan, perbuat atau berikan kepada kita. Ketika kita menghormati orang tua sebenarnya kita sedang menghormati peran yang TUHAN berikan kepada mereka, yang olehnya kita sebagai anak boleh hadir dan ada dalam dunia ini.

Renungan bagi kita hari ini adalah: pertama, kita wajib memberikan penghormatan kepada orang tua karena peran yang Allah berikan kepada mereka demi menghadirkan kita sebagai anak ke dalam dunia ini. Kedua, kita harus mau mengampuni mereka, jika dalam membesarkan kita ada kesalahan yang mereka perbuat yang menyakiti hati kita. Jangan merendahkan mereka hanya oleh karena satu atau dua perbuatan salah mereka kepada kita sebagai anak. Jangan kita kecewa akan apa yang orang tua kita tidak berikan kepada kita, sebab apa yang mereka bisa berikan itu adalah semua yang ada pada mereka. Ketiga, jika TUHAN masih memberikan kita kesempatan, buatlah segala sesuatu yang baik dan membahagiakan orang tua kita selagi kita hidup. Cintai dan sayangilah mereka, yang memungkinkan kita ada hidup sampai saat ini. Keempat, ketika kita menjadi orang tua, buatlah apa yang baik kepada anak-anak kita seperti yang kita kehendaki diperbuat orang tua kepada kita sebagai anak. Jangan sekali-kali melanjutkan apa yang tidak baik dari orang tua kita kepada anakanak kita saat ini. Ingatlah, bahwa anak-anak lebih memperhatikan apa yang orang tuanya lakukan ketimbang apa yang orang tuanya katakan. Kelima, kita menghormati orang tua kita dengan cara menjadi orang tua yang terhormat dalam membesarkan dan mendidik anak kita. Kita dapat mengasihi orang tua kita ketika kita mengetahui berada di posisi yang sama dan melihat nilai yang sama sebagai orang tua. (YMH)

Questions:
1. Menurut Anda apa yang membuat Anda bangga kepada orang tua Anda?
2. Jika Anda sudah menjadi orang tua, apakah yang ingin Anda sampaikan kepada anak-anak Anda?

Values:
Dalam Kerajaan Allah, orang tua harus dihormati karena mereka adalah mitranya Allah.

Terrible graphics and performance (Of course you have to play on very low if you want that sweet 60 with your mediocre at best PC). You want to drive fast with your car? Well no dice for you, you get stuck on a random grass texture and die in the crash, or just take off to the Moon on the smallest bump. Wanna play with friends? Good luck to you, they will be constantly crashing, and so will be you, or just run into the sweet "Network Lag Detected" message. You want to shoot somebody? Enjoy half of your bullets just sublime away if your opponent kills you first, so he takes like 50 damage instead of 80. Oh and don't even get me started on your opponents, who are going to be lvl 500 tryhards who bathe once a year, regardless if you are lvl 10, 100, 500. So good luck having fun with your friends if they are new to the game. At least it's free, even though everything in the store is super overpriced, 5-10 euros for a single dance emote etc. You can't even play a single multiplayer match until you complete the completely useless tutorial, which seems to be only there to prevent you from playing. If I want to do the tutorial, I will, but if I don't, then let me play ffs. Most of the maps are fine but I would avoid Sanhok if I were you, it's painfully bad in my opinion. So yeah, this game can be fun for some time, but it won't be if you start to take it too seriously, then it will get real frustrating real fast.

This game has a good concept.
I was one of the many unlucky people who bought the game years ago.
Back then the game was very good to play, enjoyable. 
First very bad thing of it: they make it free
It's like saying "good job idiots, you wasted 20 bucks on us now piss off".
And adding salt to the injury, in many of the games you will play, there is someone that plays with cheats or hacking and its natural, cause they don't perma ban the cheaters and hackers and if they do its no big deal cause the game is free so they come back easier than before. A good solution would be a ban system like APEX has that literally bans your motherboard but they will never do that cause they will loose people.
In other words, this game has become heaven for those who want to experiment with hacks or cheats and the developers do nothing cause they know the number of users will drop down very much very fast.
Overall, i don't recommend it. Playing this game solo is bad BUT the squad system still works its way out.
If you have friends,then i truly recommend to play it, not for the game experience, but only for the laughs you will have with your friends while playing this game.

Long learning curve but if you stick to it you will have the time of your life with or without friends to play with. This game is not like call of duty it takes a bit more patience and calculated movements to defeat your enemy through sound ques like footsteps and recoil control with pulling down the mouse.After you master the basics its all macro managing from there you start to learn how to predict end game scenarios so you can put your team mates in the best possible position to win.You can also play solos/duos,TPP/FPP, and they have an arcade mode and training ground where you can start before getting into a live game.I really love the game despite the bugs it has it really has been an adventure and i always come back to it from time to time i guess you could say this game is a love/hate relationship "dislike on occasion for better words" give it a shot no pun intended (and there is bots in the game that help fill the servers hopefully one day the games popular enough to where its not needed or less are added)

After reading all the bad reviews about hackers I was very dubious of comming back to the game. I decided to give it a try nonetheless.

The game is in a very healthy place at the moment and I have no idea what all the complaints are about.

Sure, compared to the first 2 years of the game, now you have some stupid skins, a few silly mechanics and optional battle pass crap BUT if you ignore all that the game is still there and it's still very fun.

On the bright side of new features, now you have a lot of different maps, new gadgets like an anti blue-zone consumable backpack, recon drone, decoy grenades, and others.

If you like the genre, if you played and you are hesitent to come back or if you want to try something new: I recommend it.

From boring walking simulator to intense adrenaline rush in seconds.

Only downside all the damn heavy ass updates.

It's incredibly difficult to even reach the skill FLOOR. After 1000 hours, I even struggle to average 0.5 kd. I don't care about being competitive; however, I do care about having fun. Low KD doesn't matter, it's the fact that the game has NO ranking system. You'll be paired against SEMI/PRO players even if you can't shoot straight past 15 meters. Despite removing 99.9% of the cheaters, it is still not a game of genuine challenge as your opponents have already won before MOST engagements. It's like playing amateur basketball, but the opposing team is the Lakers. You have no chance, and they might as well be cheating (they're not) because you have the same fighting chance. 

I'd recommend the game even if it had 10 min queues with SOME rank matchmaking. At least then it'd offer a genuine (surmountable) challenge for non-competitive players. For the same reason, they need to take unbalanced lobbies as seriously as they would cheaters. A game can't be fun if your opponents have a game-breaking outsized advantage (whether that's from skill or fraud.)

JAKARTA: Indonesia menamatkan operasi untuk mengeluarkan bangkai kapal selam KRI Nanggala-402 yang tenggelam di perairan Bali pada April lalu.

Lapor BBC, kapal selam itu yang membawa 53 kru dilaporkan terputus hubungan selepas meminta kebenaran untuk menyelam ketika sesi latihan torpedo.

Kapal selam yang berusia 40 tahun itu ditemukan dalam keadaan pecah kepada tiga bahagian.


Ads by Kiosked
Usaha untuk mengeluarkan bangkai kapal selam pada kedalaman lebih 800 meter dilaksanakan namun operasi itu kini ditamatkan.

“Operasi itu sudah tamat,” kata jurucakap Tentera Laut Indonesia, Julius Widjojono kepada Reuters.

Tentera Indonesia Laut dalam satu kenyataan memaklumkan pasukan gabungan Indonesia- China menyelam sebanyak 20 kali untuk merakam foto dan video serta mengumpulkan bahagian kapal selam yang tenggelam

Been playing this game since the very beginning and I have to say, its the one Battle Royal game I will play and its also trash. It comes so close to being its own unique piece of the genre, but its clunky nature (which has been inherent since day 1) always manages to trip you up when you start to find a groove / can mindlessly enjoy it. What do I mean? Well if you have bad luck, the game punishes you with long wait times to get into each game, so if you make mistakes / want to get better, its hard to get back into similar situations where can improve a skillset. Doing well? Well get ready to get wallhacked and aimbotted, cause it happens pretty commonly. Watching your deathcam is pretty much required as most barely try to hide their lack of skill as they aim at you through buildings / terrain, pop a grenade and land it directly on you without ever gaining line of sight. Its one thing to get bested by a good lvl500 player, its frustrating to constantly realize you were cheated out of yet another good game. Don't get me wrong, the game has had many improvements in terms enhanced quality of life over the years, but fundamentally, it still just doesn't know how to deliver a consistent good time.

Frankly though, if they ever truly got good at weeding out hackers, I could possibly recommend it, but that on top of it still not being a polished experience would let anyone trying to come in fresh down.

My view of a game so far.
I wanted to buy PUBG long time ago, and thing that deter me from buying was enormous price for the game. For that price you could get decent game that has wonderful singleplayer and multiplayer options. 

Now that game is F2P, and after so many videos watched of this game I had to try it. Soon after, when I noticed price for "Premium", which in my opinion reflects real value of a game (12,99$) I decided to buy to support creators and developers.

It is true, there are lots of high level players, what else would you expect of a game that is 6ish years old. There will always be better, stronger and more hours spent on game than you. You just need to play to get better.

On the off hand, literally first day of playing, couple of hours in, some player made suspiciously good headshot,  I played 'deathcam' and his aiming were looking kinda off. I reported him for cheating, didn't specify any specific reason of a report. Same day, about 6 hours later I receive message saying they banned the play I've reported. From what I've heared there are more than few cheaters in game, but on positive note they did notify me of a ban and it didn't take them whole lot of time (unlike Warzone, who by the time I stopped playing did not use anti cheat system)

Long, open sightlines and gentle hills dotted by claustrophobic buildings and small complexes. Oh, and that one map (at the time of writing) that has very little real estate that's not buildings. A variety of modes are here, and the UI is easy to read with big numbers for the important things. Details are a little fiddly once you get down to it, and some features (like the optional death cam) make me think it was once different. The shop is unintrusive, though the costs are quite high if you don't have a lot of self-control. Good game, if a little dated.

tl;dr:  Do the tutorials, learn the weapons at the firing range, learn the original map in training and cautious drops, get your kills in hot drops, learn that "first place" isn't the reason you play this game and you'll be having fun in no time.

Although this is the original "battle royale" game and it shows in the overall graphics, if you want a down-to-earth BR shooter that has bullet physics (drop over distance), doesn't hold your hand like that other BR that puts a spotlight on the end of your scope so that it's easier for people to find snipers, doesn't force your character to dress in bright colors to make it easier for others to spot you (although some of the skins you may end up buying will do the same, but at least it will be on purpose), and has a more reasonable time-to-kill than the more sci-fi BR games, then you'll end up coming back to PUBG, or finding a home for the first time in the genre.  It doesn't have the smoothest animations or best gravity constant (never been sure why), but spend enough time to "get good" and overcome your fear of hot drops once you know the map a little, and you'll be having fun before you know it.   This game is infinitely better with friends, so go get yours or make new ones in random squads.

I read somewhere that this game has a "flat learning curve", which makes no sense until you play for a while and realize that it's almost impossible to improve. I want to like this game. I want to like it a lot, but it's not fun. Maybe it is for people who have been playing for a long time, but fighting these people as a newbie is ridiculous. Basically you just run around for a while collecting all kinds of gear and weapons that you will never use, and then get shot to death before ever seeing where the enemy is regardless of what helmet or vest you're wearing. The game looks great, and everything works really well, but grouping new players in with veterans is not fun for the new players. And it's not like I've never played a video game before. I played Pong at my neighbor's when they got a home consul for Xmas, and I've been playing video games ever since. I was very good at CoD, and other FPS games, but this shit is just frustrating, and weirdly stressful.
