So what is PUBG and is it fun/worth it? Me and my friend play duo in normal, land somewhere up in the butt, find boat, drive around in it and disembark in one of the coastal towns on the left side of the classic map - we are in the zone (yay). Loot! Find a flare (first time, rare drop?). Spawn BDRM 2 (Combat Reconnaissance Patrol Vehicle - basically armoured car). Drive towards the zone, see another flare go up, but outside of the zone, decide not to chase it. Get shot at by some guy, decide not to engage and dodge him, journey continues (armoured truck HP was half gone, he fired around three mags at us from an assault rifle). See a guy running over a field. Run him over with our metal coffin (carmageddon us 1 them 0), didn't even see or hear us (sneaky snakes). Continue driving. Hear a lot of shooting on the edge of the zone, go over the hill, see the second BRDM and a guy reviving his teammate next to it behind a tree. Go down the hill at full speed and wedge our BDRM between them and their vehicle. Steal it, now we have two armoured cars xD While stealing accidentally run over the guy who was healing (that's two road kills). Race around with two BRDMs. See guys shooting at another group, we blitzkrieg them at full speed and run over one of them, don't manage to kill him completely, he crawls to a rock and keeps circling it, second guy keeps dodging us (we hit each other couple times while trying to get them). They throw a flashbang, bounces off the my tank on wheels like a peanut. We continue to try to run them over until they manage to climb the rock (they happy, floor is lava), friend goes up the hill and then goes full speed towards the rock, manages to drive on top of the rock, kills them both (that's 4 road kills). Continue driving, see a guy behind a tree, go from two sides, drops immediately (I guess his teammate  died earlier) = five kills on wheels. Four players left alive so technically 2v2, just us in the armoured cars and them hiding. Drive around until we find them (they hide behind the trees), they dodge (really damn well at that, them ninjas), until one guy screws up while running from one tree to another (success, Mad Max would be proud, got him crawling). Second opponent gets angry, shoots (funny thing is that up to this point peeps tried to dodge us and no one really shot at the armoured trucks, they can be damaged by AR/SMG), ends up blowing up friends BDRM (was damaged when we stole it). Friend manages to jump out before it explodes (Rambo, explosion on the background), Uzi-sprays the last guy, winner winner chicken dinner. 6 road kills with two assists and one SMG kill :D 

“To crush your enemies. See them driven before you. And to hear the lamentations of their women.” – Conan the Barbarian (while swapping out his horse for one of them BRDMs)

I kind of like this game, it is pretty fun and engaging. High fidelity, low stress environment.

With (personally for me) the only drawback that you have to move across the map to a specific zone, or die.
I would had rather see areas where players are active colored on the map, for instance the map divided into squares each drawn little on the map of about 500 feet in size of size of foot in the game.

With the alternative being a compass that can only be used when players are far from each other, pointing to an area of 500 feet or so, where other players reside. And then battle it out in ordinary game play, just hunting other players.

I'm an ex ARMA soldier, so it didn't surprise me I beat some noobs in the game. Still there also are some highly skilled players, probably w/ an enhanced resolution. My game looks very grainy, and I play with 1 defect speaker, so it's hard to see/hear where opponents are coming/shooting from.

Overall I give this game between 8.7 - 8.9, based on the overall game play. Also I wish there had been keys assigned and with an animation for attaching the scopes. Which in my humble opinion about this great game, would add more to the realism of the experience.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Edit (27.07.2022):
Developers have done nothing for the game. They still haven't fixed constant crashes and the game is unplayable. Was able to be in a match for less than 5 minutes before crash. First two games didn't even start as there weren't enough players joined to the server.

I bought this game, and continued to play it after it became free. Since I bought it, only a couple of maps and some (often broken or inconvenient) tactical equipment have been added, while matchmaking is still region-locked which results in NA region players having to decide between high ping VPN, and bots.

Anti-Cheat has targeted me over trivial issues. Basic user experience problems are ignored and seem to be treated as part of the gameplay's core challenge. They won't add any new large-scale modes. Matchmaking seems to prefer bots over players on another continent regardless of ping. We don't have the ability to select maps.

I really badly want to like this game, but the inattention to glaring issues has made the game not worth a support ticket. These issues include the high-stakes low-reward style deterring new players from getting better at tactical planning, matchmaking being atrocious, ranked being regional, and basic movement being extremely volatile about where you can vault and which random six-inch ledge will stop you from fleeing enemy fire.

Give me a PvPvE zombie mode like mobile did for a while, fix your anti-cheat to make players innocent until found guilty, and I will begrudgingly come back. For now, I'm sorry, I just can't play like this anymore.

I've been playing this game since ( basically ) release in 2017 across multiple platforms and accounts and have totalled around 1000 hours on the game and despite getting bored every so often and taking a break from the game i've thoroughly enjoyed playing the game itself. 

- The game is kinda unforgiving when it comes to new players but unlike other games, namely counter-strike, PUBG actually tries to ease new players in with the training features, 10 AI matches and then 3 Casual matches per day ( which have 85 bots compared to 15 players if i remember right ). I've said this about games like Fortnite before when people say that the game is bad nowadays compared to what it used to be like, but fundamentally the game is significantly better and no one can argue against this because it's simply facts. The game might not be as enjoyable as it was back 5 years ago when it was a fresh style of game and people played very different to how they do now, but there are so many more features, gamemodes, things to do in general that if we were to go back to how the game was on release, everyone would complain, theres simply no pleasing people when it comes to stuff like this sadly. 

- Another big thing about this game which i've noticed is people complaining about cheaters, and i have no idea how this "cheater problem" is such a massive debate in forums because i almost never run into cheaters or people i suspect of cheating. The only time i've encountered people that i *knew* were cheating was on my other account playing ranked against people who didn't even try to hide it, on this account there hasn't been anyone i've ran into that i've suspected of cheating, and yet you visit the forum and all you see is people complaining about cheaters. I have reason to believe its just people who aren't great at the game accusing everyone better than them of cheating due to some ego problems or something, it's very common on competitive games like Siege and CS:GO, but if you're worried about cheaters when starting this game then i hope this sways your mind a bit regarding that.

- The games balancing is fine for the most part, you'll always have people who think certain things are broken, especially when they first release, and sometimes the Devs aren't great at balancing them out. This is mainly referring to the P90, which is an SMG you find in supply drops that doesn't need attachments, has very little recoil and does a lot of damage, and the Devs tried to balance it by reducing the ammo count :/

- I should probably mention how slow paced the game can feel at times, the movement is very clunky and sluggish at times but the shooting feels fantastic, it takes some getting used to but it's satisfying once you do.

- Overall the game is enjoyable if you like the competitive side of games as well as the steep learning curve this game has, like recoil control, bullet drop and speed, the attachments, ammo etc. I do recommend the game in general though because it is fun and the Devs are constantly adding new features and maps which keep the game feeling as fresh as a Battle Royale game can be in 2022, it's a stale and outdated style that i'm glad games are moving away from, it was much more interesting 5 years ago when games like this, H1Z1 and Fortnite were new but now it's just overdone, but with that being said, PUBG is still enjoyable for the most part and if it seems interesting to you then you should give it a try ( maybe a few tries ).

This game on technical level is dog shit tier. It takes forever to load into the main menu or the match itself, has SERIOUS texture streaming issues with terrible LOD (to the point where you can't see building until last 100 meters while air-dropping) and to top it off, it crashes my graphics drivers from time to time. Seriously, I have played different titles of varying quality (recently Cyberpunk 2077, GTA IV, Fallout 4 or Ghost Recon: Breakpoint) and only this game has the ability to face-plant my GPU while trying to render PS3-era map geometry. On the newest patch it has crashed 3 times in a row on the first boot-up. Sure I can download 27 GB again but what about you? Do you have fiber internet and extra free time to troubleshoot it?

Let's get the short and simple answer out of the way, AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!! This game is an absolute travesty, 8-10 players will be closet cheaters or in most cases, not even trying to hide it. 
- ESP AKA Wall hacks are commonplace
- Auto aim is required to compete in gun trades
- Terrible game optimization
- Predatory lootbox skin system
- 90% of players use no recoil macros
- Very few level 500's are legit, most of the long time playerbase has turned to cheating as a way to even the playing field
- No map selection as of writing this, so have fun getting the same boring map 900 times in a row
- Do not be misguided by steam charts player count, this game is basically dead in any region other than China (where most of the cheaters come from)
Developers are too busy rolling in their blood money to bother listening to any of their remaining players concerns

Bread scale: A slice of toast



Update: 13.07.2022
I have a better laptop than the one I last played this game on. I wanted to go back to one of my favorite games and breathe life into it again. But from today it will probably never be played by me again.

While streaming it:
Match: 40 FPS High settings, only loaded when I was kicked out of the plane and then the buildings didn't load properly like back then, so you have to walk through walls because you can't even see a door -> bugged around until I could finally pick something up . Playing time approx. 2min.
Next Match: Set settings to lowest for FPS boost to 50 FPS and then play Combat at 10(!) FPS???
That's a joke, isn't it?

So I tried it without the stream.
80 FPS on lowest (old laptop managed 40 on lowest). Same as almost every match start. Long loading time, buildings are bugged, which took a lot of time to get equipment and weapons. Then I heard footsteps, got ready, suddenly the furniture loaded in and pushed me into the middle of the room. Then the enemy came in, I shot and before I heard my shots, the enemy was somewhere else and I was dead. My eyes went to the FPS and I was severely disappointed. I can see that when there is a lot going on, there are FPS drops. But going from 80 FPS to 35... It's sad.

Another problem are the opponents that are too high. I don't blame anyone because they enjoy playing the game and leveling accordingly. But I would like to survive more than 2 minutes like back then. Especially since it takes 1 minute to load into the match and another 40 seconds to parachute and wait until you can pick something up.

I've never been particularly good at aiming, nor do I expect this game to run at 100+ FPS for me and I don't even expect to get a kill. But if I am not even able to think because my enemies are more experienced than I (yes, got many h but I am only 150 or something).
I could have a chance against someone who is 400+... but only if he would be as bad as me..which, you guessed it, wouldn't be likely.

But I expected to have a game that would have been worth at least the price i paid for it back then.


So I have to downgrade this. They massacred my boy.

I wish PUB:G on Steam (PC) would have better controller compatibility, but other than that, I have no other issues with the game.

[h1]About game[/h1]
Playerunknown’sbattleground is a Battle royal and Survival Open World with both first-person and third-person perspective shooting. It is limited to a maximum of 100
players per match starting at the same time. If anyone can survive until the
last person. will be the winner. In addition to that, during 1 round of play,
besides the poison circle that will create excitement and fun for the players,
the game PUBG also has Airdrop and Red Zone. will come every 5-10 minutes There
are special items that cannot be found on the map, such as level 3 armor, level
3 helmets. Including high-powered guns, the Red Zone is a large red circle.
that if someone is in that circle, there will be a bomb falling from the sky If
anyone gets hit, they die instantly.
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
The players can play either Solo, Duo, or Full squad(Up to 4 people). The game has many
modes to choose from such as Zombie, Normal Mode, Ranked, Training, Team
deathmatch, etc. For a big new update, PUBG(Playerunknown’s battleground) will
adjust to Free-to-play which means you don't have to pay for the game anymore
but except for the ranking mode it needs to buy Battleground plus first for
access to ranking mode but people who bought the game earlier will get
Battleground plus for free. For the weapon, there are many weapons that
you can use such as assault rifles, SMG, sniper rifles. In addition to guns, there are also gun accessories that will drop according to different maps. for example, Calibers ranging from Red Dot, Holo scope, to caliber *4,*2, *8, and *15.
[h1]Rankmode[/h1]
In rank mode will be more special than the normal mode, the drop rate is doubled and is
limited to 64 players only. The ranking system will add points, meaning that if
you die quickly, you will lose a lot of points, but if you want to collect a
lot of points, you have to survive as long as possible, or killing enemies will
also be able to increase points as well. Ranks range from Bronze to Master. At
the end of each season, each rank will receive different rewards. But you can
only get rewards if you are in gold rank or above.

My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 18, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because PUBG gave me cancer anyway.

I BOUGHT this game back when it was in early access. I'm fine with the idea that it went free to play. That's the gamble you take with a game like that. But I stopped playing it back in early 2019 when the game was such garbage that an i7-7700k and a 1070 would get MAYBE get 32 fps. I thought I would give it another shot in 2022 since they have had some time to fix the issues. But NOW I have to finish 10 AI matches for a game I initially helped fund making. Not a huge deal to require a tutorial with a free to play game. Warzone does it (and much better). But now I am going to have to spend a solid two hours of my time to play the tutorial of a game I have 250 hours in already. Why? Because they are apparently incapable of having two senses behind developing a game. Classic PUBG. Take an interesting game, notice the problems of the game as it is in it's current state, then immediately shoot yourself in the foot when making a solution to said problem. 

People leaving your game because it's full of cheaters and the server/game itself are less optimized than a bagel in a toaster? 

Develop a new map because that will obviously solve the issues of cheating and server/game optimization. 

Make your game free to play and people flood the game that don't know what they are doing because there is no price of admission? 

Force them to play two hours of training to teach them (whether or not they are planning on playing the game with their friends that night/ they are time constrained and just want to play a new game). 


PUBG is a respectable game with decent perfomance (nowadays), that will always limp across the finish line because of the backward thinking management ideas (IMO) and poorly devised solutions that's spawned from said management ideas. Have fun with your chicken dinners, because there are steak and lobster meals elsewhere for the same amount of money spent here.

PUBG: BATTLEGROUNDS is just a whole other thing. The way it is done is well put together and makes me want to play more, first time in a long time I have not gotten this interest in-game and that much enterainment. 

It is battle royale game with unique shooting experience, focused on sound and visual quality. Each player is required to scavenge survival supplies, as well as to exploit the maximum potential of the map terrain, vehicles and gear. Main goal is to become the last team standing on the battleground. 

Point of view from player level 100:

Beggining of game is very fun, they throw you among bot populated lobbys and low tier players but you are still able to choice between: Solo, duo and squad. Staying there until level 80 to learn basics and get into game, really chill place to be and playing with other community members is enjoyable as they are mainly mature and helpfull. After a while will experience elements of adrenaline, loads of fun and desire for more. 

Once you get PUBG basic plus+ for free  there is where fun ends. No, you can't disable it. 

Lobbys will be populated with mainly level 500 players who are heavly camping and intensely sweating even in custom games. Besides their hours of experience and aiming skills it will put your skills on test. Then after few games you will realize that you need to posses skills and knowledge more then average player if you want to stay even in top 30. Not only that but will experience players who use third part softwers to gain advantages: Aimbot, no recoil, wallhack, speedhack, long shot distance hack, you name it. Then game starts becoming unenjoyable, unbalanced and unfair, especially if you play ranked matches. But you frustration gets even worst when you start noticing issues with game which you didn't care much before and they are plenty, as follows:

First of all, launching game will make you wait 90 seconds till game loads, sometimes followed with black screen and lobby sound. In late hours will
experience unpopulated lobby and wait at least 10 minutes till game starts. When joining lobby where match starts within 10 seconds it can happend that you are in plane and can hear sound of it and people jumping but your screen is still loading until plane reach almost edge of map. While jumping with parachute will most likely experiencing cracking or freezes, as well map synching problem and fps drops. If you are lucky enought crashing. You might survive that but probably won't an level 500 player on distance of 326 meters with x4 sight scope shooting at you with m4 full auto down in single dot, true obstacles and it happens to be your head. In case that you have vehicle, unrealistic drive and flipping is too easily that you might get away 2 meters away and die at distance of 328 meters. 

Support will only answer if they have benefits not even bothering to check your reports even if you sent video proof. In case getting answer it will be more in sort of automated message. 

Missed potential.

PUBG: BATTLEGROUNDS was the first battle royale game I’ve ever played. I bought it on its release, but I haven’t played it until this year. I’d like to say that after years of optimizations, patches and so on, the developers have managed to bring it to perfection, so I can’t say anything bad about it. Exactly, what can I say about the gameplay, is that it’s the same for its genre. I am very satisfied with the game, and I think that any game in that genre can’t be comparative with that one.

For the start, as long as the newbies get matched with experienced players, there won't be any new players because every normally thinking person will just leave after 5-10 matches. Good luck with this game, but from what I see in reviews, it's full of cheaters anyway. It's also crashing for no obvious reason, optimisation is basically non-existent, unpleasantly blurry distance view - no matter the graphics settings, your character is partly pixelized - again, no graphic settings fixed it.
Well, honestly, no wonder long-time players are just leaving.
So to put it all together, new-comers are being pushed out by hackers and players with 1000h+ and most likely because of crashing game. And veteran players who experience nearly the same issues simply leave as well.
How to fix it? Well, get anti cheat, fix the game, create sensible matchmaking and hope there still some people interested in playing PUBG instead of childish Fortnite.
The end :)

Beware snowflakes, stop reading now, critical personal opinions to follow:

Returned to the game after a good whiles break, it was like nothing had changed, which seemed to be a good thing, however. Bots in every game outside ranked fucking ruin the game. Theres nothing fun about killing the bots, and it dulls the gameplay to the point where you're near asleep by the time you fight players.

If you do choose to play "ranked", you're forced to play a selection of the utterly garbage maps they've thrown in. The only decent addition to the map pool Vikendi/snowmap, they've removed, and unfortunately the braindead audience in southkorea seems to have voted garbage like Sanhok as their favorite map, so theres no change in sight. While ranked games do provide you with only human players you are forced to play squads, and as someone who primarily enjoyed Duos its sad to see that I can't even sit around in longer queues and wait for a ranked duos match even if i wanted to.

Like I said, upon return it seemed like everything was just as it used to, yet this is the problem. Even under Brian Greene this game was being run like an absolute trainwreck, and anyone with half a brain could envision and steer this game to be a great product. However he failed, and Krafton or whoever is running this has utterly failed. Everything is underwhelming, the playlists are utter garbage, the lootbox systems have been blatantly copied off other games and are somehow the worst copy I've seen, and the few things good they added to the game they've somehow fucked up and removed.

At this point theres simply too many other options to bother playing this game, which is sad and pathetic considering the opportunity they had.

Now with the game that went free-to-play, the playing field for players who have not played in ages like myself or new players is much more balanced, and you can (re)learn the game on your own pace. I played PUBG very little, but i have the game since it was in beta. 

In later seasons, i did come back shortly, but didn't enjoy it due to the fact that there were too many experienced players already among newer ones, and felt very much like a unbalanced matchmaking, or that you were simply way too rusty to compete.

PUBG has improved and changed a lot since, and i feel going F2P was the right move here to once again bring in new players and balance out matchmaking. Surprisingly, PUBG putting ranked behind PUBG + is a decision i can stand behind, and that one is to keep as many cheaters out of them. (and in terms of cheaters, i also haven't noticed any obvious cheaters since i played again)

Make no mistake, this is also not a game you should take lightly, and PUBG has a steep learning curve, from gun handling to using peaking, cover and angles to your advantage, and most importantly, listen well and look well, PUBG gives zero indications, other than sound, from which direction you are getting shot from.

For people who return or want to pick it up, i would suggest just playing it and learning it, and like myself, who probably has no intent on ever touching ranked, casuals are just as good for me to play now from time to time.
Coming from xbox to pc, this game is unrecognizable. I will continue to enjoy this favorite of mine.

Sometimes fun, often frustrating. Someone in a squad of 4 crashes every other game or so.

My friends have a mantra when we play this, "it's a good game." Random crashes and disconnects? "It's a good game." Buggy guns that don't load until you drop them and pick them back up? Network desync makes it seem like you got knocked out behind cover? Footstep audio glitches? "It's a good game." Some of the jank is fun (vehicle physics!), but in a game based on randomly distributed advantages it's unbearable when you are betrayed by unreliable software.

Still having fun with it, though, it's a fun group game if everyone is on the same page. Core BR mechanics were revolutionary and still draw me in where higher-paced competing franchises do not.

Shame about the lack of customer support (the Steam support link gives a 404 as of March 2022), and the anti-cheat solution feels half-baked (day long bans are handed out based on player reports, regardless of if you were actually cheating... hackers keep playing after short break, legit players get frustrated).

I mean, I 've been playing this game [b]almost[/b] since it got released. Lots of hours wasted, lots of fun stuff have happened in PUBG's battlegrounds. Unfortunately, I will have to say that it's one of the best battle royals in the market, that focuses on gun-play, and not on building mechanics, or magic spells or whatever. That says a lot, because ...

On the downsides, the game has a lot of cheaters, even with the 3-4 anti-cheats they have added into the game. Bugs and crashes are not uncommon, even on high-end rigs. For a new player, up to level 80, you will face mostly bots on your games - and there is nothing you can do about it. Finally, the company is extremely greedy, which is reflected upon their market, that is filled with overpriced digital clothing and skins, that many of them are not even marketable. 

If you have friends to play this game, go ahead. Otherwise, stay away from it, as far as possible.

Apparently this game is now 4 years old, and they haven't done a thing about the hackers and other cheaters? Is it supposed to be fun when you view the Death Cam and see that the other person was able to perfectly follow your character's/"playerunknown"'s head, even through walls? What's the point of this game claiming to have an anti-cheat system when it doesn't even prevent wallhacks? At this point, your game is far more likely to end via hacking than due to someone actually being any good at the game. There's a reason that videos proving cheating in this game are so common.

Tried to just play offline, as online play is often overrated... and turns out that it's limited, and the bots in this game are terrible, worse than the AI in some 90's FPS games.

May as well have been made by EA. All they care about is selling loot boxes. The quality of their game clearly doesn't matter to them, just making stupid costumes. I may have put more effort into this review than they've put into fixing the bugs in their game.

PUBG is a game that I have played almost religiously since the beta. I loved this game a lot, but I noticed as time went on, the game's performance declined. The devs refused to optimize it and even back when I did play, the test server ran at least 5 times better than the live servers. So I know that it was possible to optimize it better, but I waited and waited and it never happened. Finally, after playing it since the beta, I got randomly banned for 'cheating' in late 2021. I have seen this happen to way too many players as well, specifically the ones who are actually good at the game: like TGLTN, who seem to get banned every other month for cheating when they are clearly not. On top of that, they have no way to be unbanned if proof is shown that you did not cheat. I lost out on 30-50 dollars, between my inventory and actually paying for the game, because of this. I simply cannot recommend this game to anybody, but my voice doesn't matter in the grand scheme here.

After 3 years and 3,250 hours of gameplay, I was Permanently Banned from PUBG without any reasoning provided. I have purchased every Event Pass,making the account worth a great deal to me in many ways.

This was a VAC ban, and I have never cheated in any game in the 6 years I have owned STEAM. as I am not a good player). I've always enjoyed playing the game regardless of its many shortcomings (desync issues, glitches and bugs from updates, aimbotters, etc.). But to devote so much time toward a game and then be outright Permanently Banned for absolutely no reason is absurd.

I took the time to submit a dispute ticket to PUBG Support, but in return I simply received an automated message stating the rules of the game, one of which was *apparently* violated. It was not a personal response, as the reviewer clearly did not investigate the Ban, he/she just copied and pasted an automated response.

My advice: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS GAME. Perhaps if you play infrequently and do not get reported by users enough (salty players who report all others who eliminate them) you will not get banned. But there is no guarantee. You can get sucked in and spend money on each Event Pass just to eventually be banned without reason. Such a shame.

Player Unknown Battle Grounds Review:
________________________________
Okay so starting off I just wanna say... This game is absolutely fucking incredible,
It is a Battle Royale-Tactical-Shooter, Basing off realism combat strats and more.
The game is one of the best Battle Royale Shooters you're gonna find unlike games like, Fortnite, Warzone, and things like that. Those games are pretty unrealistic when it comes to gun control moving around the maps looting and things like that or tho warzone is not a bad game this game just beats it in everyway, Lemme explain.
( Side Info: Due to this game focusing on realism its fun and makes you feel the fear of death. But dying is only one way to learn in this game so dont get mad if you die learn from it and improve by your old mistakes.)
_________________________
( Gameplay ) :
Starting off with Gameplay let's talk about guns and gun control.
Guns feel real, and fun to use in this game not only with their control+firerate+sounds 
They are just awesome to use in this shooter,
The guns kind of handle like in CSGO as in you are more accurate when not moving and hit more shots when not spraying. But the twist is in this game you can! This game takes time to master the guns so dont get discouraged by how hard they are to use at first. (USE SEMI FIRE WHEN A NEW PLAYER!)
remember this game focuses on realism. So of course like i said their hard to use. Now The Sprays on the guns are pretty basic but at times can be different, For starters the AK-47 A basic world known and loved gun by a lot of people. It's got a pretty basic spray but massive recoil how do you control this? First of all, any game that uses real video footage of actors in action scenes to advertise their game, is usually a terrible game.  

On to review key points of the game.

-Bugs-
I have been playing Player Unknown BattleGrounds, off and on since it was first released on Xbox and eventually switched to PC.  So, I have been through a lot of the bugs and failures this game has seen.
Anytime there is an update, something has been fixed and something else is broken.

-Cheaters-
Guys, it’s like breathing air now, you’re always going to have hackers in games, cause some people naturally suck and wouldn’t be able to win without cheating.  That being said there is a lot of cheaters that play this one.  The game does offer a way to report people for many different offenses, and they will notify you via a game message if something has been done about said cheater.

-Game Modes-
One game mode I enjoy playing, is the one that allows you to play against bots and a limited number of players.  It’s nice to get 10 kills under your belt before having to go up against the hacker teams. Unfortunately, your only allowed to play in this game mode three times per real life day.  
Also, there is a training option, where you play a full match against nothing but dumb bots, sadly that is only able to be played solo, and would be better if you and a friend or two could go in and actually "train".

-Recommendations to the Creators- 
: There is a level, while you’re being flown into the area the plane suddenly explodes into flames and it seems to be going down (very cool idea), but it never actually does.  Make this plane randomly explode, forcing people out of the plane sooner.  If it doesn’t randomly explode, then it should be allowed to crash into the ground, killing all that were afk immediately.  
: Put all the maps in a set rotation.  I’m sure that I am not the only one sick of playing the same maps over and over again. 
: I need more dance emotes with good music… It’s the only thing that makes me happy while playing this game. Dancing over the dead body of an aim hacker.
: Get rid of the initial lag when going into the inventory menu. Playing a normal PUBG match and it happening the first time isn't game breaking. However, when your playing TDM, getting the lag every single time after respawning over and over and over, is ridiculous. 
: Allow for a custom loadout in TDM, so I won't have to become annoyed with the pathetic lag every time I go into the inventory screen just to make a simple attachment swap. 
: Seeing how you guys have made this game free to play now, you could show your paying customers some love.  Like refunding me the money i spent on this game, or maybe at the least you throw me some loyal unknown player costume, or fancy emote dance, a ton of free coins. Just a thought.

Overall, after many years, a lot of spit polish, you have a fancy looking turd known as PUBG.  
Sound effects are good.
Gameplay and controls are good.
Visual Effects are good.
Replay value is Moderate/high, if you don’t mind being cheated every now and then.  However, most normal people will move on to bigger and better things.

I have to be honest, the cheaters in this game, at this point, have prevailed. Those hacking,  r**ar**d f****ing cancerous piecces of s*** have actually won, and this game totally belongs to them now. 
The infamy of this game holds true from the very beginning, no matter how low your rank is, it could be your first PvP game and there is like, a 1/10 chance that some @$$hole will blow up the drop plane and earn 99 kills and then from there there's like a 50% chance that you'll encounter some d0uchebag with an aimbot who will smoke you with headshots from across town. 

I used to love the thrill of hyper-realistic survivalistic combat, but its just gone. It's a game that belongs to those who know how to exploit it. I still believe it can be fun for certain people, especially if getting picked off by an enemy you will never see makes you laugh rather than get mad, but for me and likely many players, it's a total buzzkill simulator. The rounds take so long, so exchanging bullets with another player is kinda the whole point, but seriously you'll have more fun against a bot than someone actively trying to win because seriously, 80% of the time that player will be running either aim assist, wallhacks or downright aim-bot to make sure that happens, and the devlelopers aren't doing anything to stop them exccept MAYBE banning them for 24 hrs when they're blatantly obvious. 

I cant recommend this game to players like me who rely on strategy and twitch-shooter instincts to play this game simply because it's not truly a survival game anymore, it's more like a party game at best. The game takes too long to play and every gd game is just a doomsday clock until you run into the player who's in it to "win" and is shamelessly using one or more of the MANY
 -VERY- accessible cheats to do so, and I'm if you're like me and that's not the way you play, you're just doomed, no matter how talented you are, and that's just kinda f***ed up in my opinion. 

PUBG in the manner I grew up with it is now only available against bots, and the bots suck, so seriously, don't even let it take up room on your hard drive.

And ffs, do your part to end the cheating epidemic, ALLOW other players to have a little fun and play fairly and report everyone who's getting 80 kills per death, they're ruining the game industry.

Would I recommend this game? Yes, but with a few caveats: 
- Bots make up anywhere from ~70-95% of each match
- Drastic skill level difference for new players, as most players are level 500
- Map variation from match to match is for the most part okay, although Vikendi and Paramo nearly never enter the map cycle
   Most of this is just part of the natural life cycle of a game this old. The skill difference is not too bad for the most part, but I highly doubt a player under level 150-250 is going to win a match, let alone consistently win. Despite these issues it's still fun, especially in Duos or Squad matches and for a free game I'd reckon it's worth the 40GB storage.

Woodle Deluxe is a cute and colourful 3D action platformer ideal for children and adults alike, and third game in the Woodle universe series. I'd score it a decent 8.5 out of 10 for great family fun. It includes two modes of play; i.e. single player and a local cooperative mode, where the second player can play as Woodle Beaver. It's a nice relaxing platforming adventure with no time constraints and is ideal for all the family. You can wander around in an open world environment, but don't wander off the edges of the world, otherwise you are transported back to the beginning of the level.

It may also be possible to play with a friend online with Steam, but I've not tested that option. When you first boot the game up, a small window appears that indicates that you can play cooperatively, both locally or online.; however, I see no option in the menus that enables the online option???

Of the 40 Steam reviews currently available (as of 29th April 21) for Woodle Deluxe since its release on the 18th Feb 2021, most are positive; which is a very good sign and bodes well for the games popularity. Personally I'm not big into 3D platformers, but I actually really enjoyed playing this in short bursts of around 40 minutes. I found the game entertaining and very easy to play.

The difficulty level lends itself to the younger player, though older player who aren't your usual platformer aficionados' will also benefit from the simple controls. There are eight distinct worlds to explore from snow covered environments to deserts all floating in the sky. You can zoom out using the mouse wheel to get an idea of how big each level is or zoom right in to be up close and personal. This ability also enables you to see the area's you still have to explore. The game reminded me of that brilliant 3D platform game that was released about 15 years ago called Atmosphir, which sadly died a death due to the way it was funded (you paid a monthly subscription, but got the game for free), but the very playable client is still available online for free HERE, but the servers have gone. Still, you can create your own 3D platform worlds that look as good as this game.

My son loved this game when it was still in development and won an Atmosphir Tee Shirt for winning 'level of the week' . Literally hundreds of levels were submitted by the community at its height as it also includes a level editor. Sadly Woodle Deluxe does not include a level editor, which in my opinion would make this an even better game..

As you progress through the levels you can unlock various items and clothing to dress your character in. You control your Woodle character using the WASD or the arrow keys for movement and Space to Jump. To swat enemies with the leaf you pick up at the start of the first level (when you enter your home), use the left Mouse button. If enemies hit you with their projectile weapons before you manage to swat them, you will be send you back to the beginning of the level, but you don't lose the berries or the fairy tears you've collected. You have to collect a specific number of berries and fairy tears to progress to the next level. When you get to the end of the level you'll find three white cups, which you have to fill with the fairy tears before being transported back to your home; where you'll find a new world has been unlocked. Just approach this to be transported to the next level.

There are several languages available, which can be selected from the options menu. e.g. English, русский Russian), Español, Italiano, Français, 日本語 (Japanese), Português, Nederland, Deutsch,中文 ( Chinese), Türkçe, Polski, Dansk (Danish), Svenska (Swedish) plus two others one an Arabic language and one a Far East language (couldn't figure them out in the time I had available for this review)

You can change the resolution from 640 x 480 at 75Hz to a maximum of 840 x 2160 at 60 Hz, with six quality settings from Very Low to Ultra. The difference between the lowest and highest quality settings presents itself with shadows and shading, with the lowest setting having no shadows etc. You can play in either a window, borderless or full screen mode. Changing the resolution from the highest to the lowest will reduce the size of the window when in Windowed mode, if in borderless mode the size of the game area will adjust to the resolution you have set the game to and the sides of the game area will appear black; this also depends on what type of monitor you have. With multiple monitor set ups the game will open in your number one monitor.

Overall this is a very laid back platformer that is simple to play. Some of the obstacles can be a little tricky because you cannot change the camera viewing angle (it would improve the game play experience greatly if the developer added this to the control mechanics; usually the middle mouse button held down allows for changing the viewpoint in some games); however, once you've mastered the movement, it is a very minor issue. It took me several attempts to ascend the waterfall area in level one to the highest levels, where you complete the first level. With eight different environments, this should give you easily a good three or four hours or more of game play, unless you want to speed run it. For someone who is looking for a laid back experience, or one they can share with their young children, this is an ideal starter game. I'm not usually into platformers, but Woodle Deluxe was a pleasure to play as there was little in the way of any stressful game experiences (apart from when I overshot some platforms and fell into nothingness before reappearing a the beginning of the level.

You can see a couple of You Tube videos created by the Steam community members PepperHomie HERE and Throneful HERE. You can also see my review complete with in game images HERE

Strawberry Cheesecake French Toast

Ingredients:

4 Slices Bread
4 Eggs
1 Tablespoon Vanilla
1 Cup Milk
1 Tablespoon Cinnamon
4 oz. Warm Cream Cheese
2 Tablespoons Vanilla Extract
2 Tablespoons Lemon Juice
¾ Cup Heavy Cream
1 ½ Cups Strawberry, Diced, Divided
⅓ Cup Sugar
Confectioners Sugar
Maple Syrup

Preparation:

1.Whisk eggs, cinnamon, vanilla and milk together in medium-large bowl to create egg wash.

2. In medium bowl mix cream cheese, vanilla, sugar, lemon juice and heavy cream (optional).

3. Take 2 slices of bread and spread mixture on both.

4. Press sliced strawberries on both slices & press together.

5. Dunk in egg wash.

6. Melt butter in a skillet on medium-low heat and cook bread for 2-3 minutes or until crumbs are crispy and bread is more solid.

7. Stack and garnish with strawberries and confectioners sugar. Add maple syrup to preference.

Is this game a little old? Yes. Is it obvious that it's a little old when playing? Yes.  PLEASE get past that though.  This game is made for people that seek really good gun play in a shooter or BR.  There are no janky building mechanics, or broken guns that you have to find in order to have a good game.  PUBG absolutely focuses on getting good at the gun play and outplaying people with good strategies.  The guns all have recoil WAY more aggressive than most other games I've played, with pretty brutal bullet drop, and creates a need to develop muzzle awareness.  After getting over the learning curve, getting a kill in this game is way more satisfying than any other BR out now.  One of the biggest highlights of this game is the anti-cheat.  When PUBG went free to play, I assumed that hacking would become a huge problem that wouldn't be met with much response.  I was very wrong.  There have been several occasions that I've been playing the game and come across a blatant hacker (tracking through walls, snapping aim, getting kills even when not shooting, etc.) and reported them after spectating.  Each time I've seen a blatant hacker I have received an in-game notification letting me know that the account has had a 24 hour, or permanent ban with an hour.  It's the most responsive I've seen a game with cheaters, and it outperforms most modern BRs when it comes to cracking down on cheating.  Now that this game is free to play, it is the PERFECT time to give it a try.  I highly recommend it.

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead– murdered by my brother-in-law, Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now, and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, he asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded. I... I always thought Hank was a very moral man, and I was particularly vulnerable at the time – something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me in on a ride-along and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin, so I agreed. Hank had a partner, a businessman named Gustavo Fring. Hank sold me into servitude to this man. And when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling-out. Things escalated. Fring was able to arrange – uh, I guess... I guess you call it a "hit" – on Hank, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured. And I wound up paying his medical bills, which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge. Working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring. The bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA. To keep me in line, he took my children. For three months, he kept them. My wife had no idea of my criminal activities, and was horrified to learn what I had done. I was in hell. I can't believe I deprived myself from this jem all these years. I thought about buying this game several times over the last years but each time I felt discouraged after reading the many reviews from players complaining about the rampant cheating going on in the servers, among other problems. Maybe back then the cheating was a real problem, I don't know.. But about a month ago decided to give the game a chance because its free. I mean, yes, somethimes one get supicious of how fast they kill you but for the most part I don't think cheating is an actual problem with the current state of the game. The game has a lot to things to improve yes, but if you take the time to learn how to properly play it, its going to bring a lot a enjoyment in your life (a lot of frustration too, but for the most part its enjoyment). So, the game in february 2022 is a solid 9/10. I hope it just get better from now on. Legendary Counter-Strike level of classic.

For being a game that was a massive international phenomena, This game is TERRIBLE. It boggles my mind how this game consistently gets so many active players with the low quality graphics, sounds, mechanics, and slow gameplay. I used to go on pubg binges on my phone when it was blowing up but that was well over 4 years ago , but the fact that the pc version isnt any better quality despite not having hardware limitations, almost no improvements on the game have been made in favor of focusing on cosmetics in all these years, and is headed by a shitty company.  You want a good f2p shooter? Play Fortnite, CSGO, Apex, Warzone, Valorant, should I go on? For a game that has been such a hit for so many years as well as being a paid for title most of its life, this is shameful. This is not worth your time. I should not be playing a game that has had billions of dollars flow into it, and it having the feel of a small indie dev trying to make a low budget free fps game for their 100 yt subscribers. The space has gotten much more competitive and if you want to keep your market share, FIX YOUR GAME.

its like the dark souls of battle royale. no hitmarkers or arcade shooter style movement. Its the OG BR game and its still incredibly fun. Sound design is great and your ears end up becoming one of your strongest tools.

Do I recommend this game? Yes. Why? Because it's one of the best (and realistic) BRs. But, since it went into F2P model, it's full of cheaters. Cheaters were present before F2P, but not in this number. The game is now infested with them.

Current state of PUBG (performance) - it is well optimized, controls are fine, lags are minimal (comparing to Beta when it was out of hand with everything).

I still recommend PUBG, if You have time to waste, at least Ranked matches are good (and there is like 80% less cheaters).

Overall, if You like BRs, give it a try. =)

Gave this game a go recently, due to all the popularity it enjoyed over the years and the fairly impressive competitive scene on Twitch.

Pros:
- Satisfying gun, looting, and BR mechanics

- Large maps allowing for strategic and methodical play, instead of pure boom-and-zoom like certain other games in this genre

- Compelling inertia-based movement and parkour

- Very fun having fights with legitimate players

- Replay system is novel and educational

Cons:
- Cheating is completely, utterly out of control; the amount of boosted level 500 accounts running around with 100% perfect awareness and recoil control and pre-aiming is asinine (let alone the more blatant idiots that just stare at players through solid objects and don't even make a slight effort of hiding their cheats). The difference between fighting a legit player and a cheater is as clear as night and day, but the anticheat barely seems to pick up on any of it. I would hazard a guess at least 30% of the players I encountered were cheating to some degree, with the majority using more 'subtle' levels of location awareness and recoil reduction.

- The cosmetics are absolutely terrible. They look awful - nurse outfits, clowns, neon colors, "K-pop" clothing, trash that even Fortnite does better - and the systems to obtain them are even worse, a fresh hell of lootboxes and 'resources and blueprint' collection and 'crafting' (mostly through exorbitantly priced items in the game store only available for RL-equivalent currency). It's probably the worst cosmetic system I've seen in any game yet. A new player has little to chance of obtaining even something basic that they actually want without spending a large amount of cash. This is one factor that Super People does much better.

- Sounds are not reliable. People can be running in near proximity to you on a hilltop and you won't hear it; they can be on the floor of a building right beneath you and sound like they're walking on dirt outside; gunshots can sound like they're next to you when they're hundreds of meters away.

- Q/E lean spam is stupidly easy to do and stupidly effective at literally dodging bullets without impacting aim much if at all. It's not Call of Duty tier of cranked movement shenanigans, but it's still annoying that something so simple and silly-looking can be so ridiculously effective at making it hard for enemies to hit you.

- Grass & bushes are deceptive, and more often hinder your visibility far more than they make it hard for enemy players to see you, much of which is evidently due to the draw range which can be reduced by changing a graphics setting.

- Physics and movement leaves many things to be desired: aiming out of windows or over ledges is often wonky, exiting a car that is supposedly stopped can still be lethal, descending a somewhat steep slope can result in a sudden 'falling death', etc.

- The game only allows you to enter a training/practice mode against bots 10 times. It's possible the custom games allows you to play against bots more, but I didn't feel like investing the cash to buy Pubg "Plus" in order to find out.

- AI bot behavior leaves numerous things to be desired. This thread I feel gives a good rundown of the topic: https://old.reddit.com/r/PUBG/comments/st3hha/lets_talk_about_bots_and_how_to_improve_them/


Overall the experience was frustrating, because the core gameplay can be very rewarding - but it's disrupted by blatant widespread cheating, and the horrendous cosmetic system, which makes the goal of 'progression' a moot point.

Played this game since Beta and enjoyed it for a very long time (obviously). But now the game is F2P, which exasperates a lot of very big problems previously there with PUBG. Let's get down to specifics.

-Hackers and Script users

This has always been a problem, make no mistake the reviews arn't just trolling. The majority of the time before it was F2P, they were somewhat rare? Certainly not going to ruin your night, maybe 1 or 2 in 30 hours of game. This is perfectly reasonable, you can not catch them all. HOWEVER it has been a DRASTIC change since this game has gone F2P. Weather it's budget cuts, or the increased volume of players, the way it has been since the update to F2P has been downright unacceptable for a shooter of this size (reference steam active user counts). You guy's really need to address this, above anything else I list here.

-Frequent game crashes

Title says it all here, doesn't matter if someones shooting at you, you're driving, or just walking in the middle of nowhere, since the F2P launch the crashes just keep on coming! This alongside a very noticeable dip in server stability in the first 5 minutes of a match, which is HORRIBLE because that is one of the most important times NOT to lag.

-Corrupted Files

This one has happened to me twice now since the F2P update and good lord is it a huge negative influence to bearing with your game. My patience died today after Today's most recent 2 updates, my Resource files were corrupted and you have the audacity to pop up an error message asking IF I KNOW HOW TO FIX THE ISSUE. Are you serious!? So not only do I have to reinstall the entire game, after a 2 hour update already, but you want me to fix the bug for you. No, i'm gonna pass. First time I had a corruption issue, all I had to do was some relatively annoying trouble shooting and got it to work, this time however is not being so generous. 

-Match Making

Ohhhhh boy. You would have thought the match making would have improved with the huge increase in player base? Absolutely not. You will meet one of three types of people in PUBG, a F2P noobie, a lvl 500 diehard fan of PUBG, or a hacker. One of these problems can be solved very easily, stop matching my friends who are lvl 25 against people who are lvl 500. It's pretty simple really, no one likes to be outclassed by a sweaty nerd who probably thinks you're a bot and provides zero challenge to them. Squads especially are a problem because of this, stop pairing the lvl 500 players with lvl 12 players. They never stay in the pre-game lobby, thus making the team uneven.

This game still has so much potential to be better than this, it is the reason I have over 1000 hours played. Some of the best Battle Royal shooting in the industry to this day. You have absolutely nailed the gunplay. But for heavens sake, you haven't even fixed the "invisible" rocks that send you flying off your motorbike to your death after 5 years, why should I believe things will get better? 

NO I would not recommend this game at this time. It's always been hard to recommend, but when I did I could say I had faith it would get better in time. I no longer believe that.

If I'd written this in 2018 when this game was at its best I'd have certainly recommended it but in its current state in 2022 I'd have real difficulty even considering its F2P release. When it first released it genuinely felt like such an exciting game, no game really had the same feel to it, but then the Battle Royale genre started to expand and PUBG was really just left in the dust as other titles had something new and exciting which this just didn't. Admittedly, PUBG has always maintained a kind of quasi-realistic shooter vibe but this is hard to believe after so many years. PUBG was at its best early on as I said when it a pretty bare bones grungy survival shooter which thrived on its addictive simplicity. But now its just declined into a fairly forgettable battle royale among many despite futile attempts by developers to revive any life it still has left. No addition since Miramar have felt meaningful, cosmetics and a season pass have just made it blur into the plethora of dead-beat "live service"  games and F2P was really just too little too late. There is no way the developers could expect people to pay for this game in 2021. As far as gameplay goes its okay but isn't anything special, its like whenever PUBG does something at this point another game does it better. In short, PUBG has seen much better days and if you're looking for a battle royale try it, you've got nothing to lose except the time it takes to install, but its far from its 2017/2018 glory days.

Hello! On behalf of the participant of the Windows Insider Program, I inform you that the launch of the application on Windows 11 is difficult.
If you encounter a driver error "xhunter.sys" it means that you do not have an anti-cheat and cannot start. 

Go to the system anti-virus settings and find the kernel isolation setting. It is located in the Device Security section. If you can't control this setting, the game can't be launched at this time. On the other hand, if you can disable the setting, do it before installing and running the game. However, as soon as the game is installed, turn it back on, because this is an important functionality!
The problem will be solved with the update of the anti-cheat system. The update date depends on the software developer and is unknown to me. Hope my review helped you

Regards, the Microsoft community.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

OK, here is the deal. I was playing, crossing a bridge and got shot on from the distance. I was trying to avoid the shots by running left to right. Out of the sudden the game started lagging and I was not in control of my movement. The lag stopped after about 1s but something very strange happened: my character started moving randomly and I could not do anything besides watching how I am getting shot at and inevitably die. My pc is not high end by any means but I can play other shooters just fine without this things happening to me. The fact that this game is still around after around 5 years and I get this problem is making me very angry at the devs. I heard about players hacking by doing this type of stuff on other players but I do not think that is the case. To be fair, if I was the target of a hacker which could mess up my movement it is even worse than the game being not optimized. I hope one day this game will become great again but it definitely seems like today is not the day.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2020 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

PUBG Ragegrounds. Good design, crappy engineering. The game is packed with cheaters. There is an instant replay and so you are forever catching jerkoffs as they stalk you through walls or snipe you even through dense layers of grass occlusion. You'll also see guys who are aiming way above your head and off to the side and they spray into the air and all the shots hit you. Were they cheating? Is the game's network replication shit? There's no way to tell. But in theory, the replay should be flawless since it's playing back events without any latency or missing packets. There is massive mouse lag even at 25 FPS, where you can shake the mouse back and forth and watch as your view wiggles out of unison. Perhaps most pointlessly and unnecessarily infuriating is the handling of the ADS command. Initially, I assumed maybe you have to be standing really still, just because it seemed so particular and erratic. I just played again, hopefully for the last time, and noticed that it has nothing to do with your movement. There is less than like a 50% chance that the game is going to pick up the ADS binding because it insists to be as hair-pullingly rage-inducing as possible. And then there's where I ambush some guy with an LMG and he just turns around and shoots me. That's garbage. That is hits simply not registering.

This game is hugely overrated and its popularity is inexplicable. I assume people like it because it's well designed, but unfortunately it plays like ass from a practical perspective. I would play COD Warzone instead, if my computer were up to it.

PUBG is a "military simulation" battle royale game. As a mil-sim BR, it plays much different from Warzone, Fortnite, and Apex. The biggest difference is mobility. You can't slide or fly or glide around, you are human and run/walk most places like in Tarkov. There is higher weapon recoil and more realistic bullet physics than Apex. If you want something more arcade-like as a superhuman play Apex or Fortnite. If you want something more realistic play PUBG.

Cheating allegations are overblown and much better than the past, PUBG is on par with any other battle royale game regarding cheats. I've played over 100 matches and reported people for suspected cheating twice. This is mainly hyperbole by morons who don't understand how the game works and display their ignorance on the discussion forums.

Performance wise PUBG is less optimized than games from big studios like EA or Activision, so if you want a smooth 120 FPS at all times with no FPS drops, maybe try something else. The game sometimes fails to boot from Steam's Big Picture mode, but I've never experienced one in-game crash. Personally I have no complaints about the performance it plays perfectly fine for me.

The biggest problem I have with PUBG is the developer Krafton's puzzling design choices. They split the game into third person perspective matches (TPP matches) and first person perspective matches (FPP matches), effectively dividing the player base in half. Why? Why divide the player base by FPP and TPP? This is so stupid, they are trying to please everyone and only end up making the game worse.

The matches are filled with bots so out of every 100 players, at least half are bots. This is not ideal and makes the game less exciting, but it's understandable why they do this so that you can always join a match easily and it's honestly not a huge deal.

All in all I definitely recommend the game and think it's fantastic, however at the end of the day people have different tastes and this isn't everyone's cup of tea. Personally I think it's a great game and was the mil-sim BR king for years, but it does have flaws.

This game saved my life.

I am 41.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

Before the haters complain "you just got naenae'd by a better player" I've logged many, many hours on here. It's pretty damn obvious, and the timing lines up with the F2P changeover... Unless the sudden influx of level 5 players following you with their reticle  through the wall of a building in replays,, from 200yds away, then flicking headshots, they all just happen to be esports pros who "discovered" a 5 year old game.

Despite going through some rough years since launch full of cheaters and horrible performance on almost any system PUBG still sits among the other top BRs on the market.
Now that it's free to play and has a functional anti-cheat and runs smooth on most computers I can recommend giving it a shot!

Bad things:
Player balancing is awful, I'm always getting into a lobby with people who are high levels that are level 200 to 500, low levels that just started playing the game. Tryhards and sweats are the people who are high ranked but I do see low ranks be like them too. Sometimes winning (miraculously) but usually losing. Cheating isn't that much of a problem here because for some reason, not a lot of people cheat in Asia servers, well, for me. But I do see people with suspicious aim and little to no recoil. PUBG became F2P which means more hackers.
Good things:
PUBG is still a game that's at least somewhat entertaining and fun when you win. Playing it with friends is much more fun than queuing with random people. If your team can communicate, you have probably more chance of winning. 
Conclusion:
Don't get it. PUBG, please build a better cheat engine so that your game wont be bombarded with thumbs down and remove microtransactions.

As much as I wanted to like it, lets be honest it's janky as hell compared to some other FPS games. The characters are stiff and slow to react and the animations for the character feel unnatural and again slow to react. The graphics are pretty poor by today's standards, hell, they were poor for Dec 2017 and they've done nothing to fix that. In fact, apart from a couple of questionable map designs have they ever actually added anything meaningful to the game? Lets be honest, if it didn't have some pseudo z-list e-sports celeb attached to it, it would never have garnered the interest it did. And now the Developers are desperately trying to squeeze the last few drops of life out of it by making it Free-to-play in the hopes it'll boost it's failing player base. 

Normally if a game is free to play I'd say; Have at it! Give it a shot! What have you got to lose? But in this instance, save you time and hard drive space. With the amount of coverage it's had with Steam highlights/YouTube vids/Twitch clips etc. you've seen absolutely EVERYTHING this game has to offer, which isn't very much to be honest. There are plenty other fps games out there that are better and do the whole battle royal thing better as well. Without Player Unknown's name attached to it, this would have been throw in a dumpster fire day 1.

And for the love of GOD I don't know why but this game feels so slow in comparison with CS... it's like I press a button and it takes almost 2 seconds until the character moves............. and the recoil is a disaster watch a video on yt for the love of GOD to see how the recoil of a weapon looks only morrons get their weapons in their faces.............. are the devs that did this kids?

One of the first famous battle royales is free to play finally. Still good match experiences although graphics and movement are a bit outdated. One big map with 100 players (4-5 different maps). Easy to join, hard to master.

+ Different match selections: solo, 2 player teams or 4 player teams
+ Casual mode (some AI players)
+ Some small maps for quick fights between two teams
+ You can collect custom clothes for Your char
+ Drivable vehicles with different seat places
+ You have some time to revive Your wounded team-mate
+ You manage to survive in the storm some time
+ You can find modifications for Your weapons during the match
+ You can carry at the same time: two long distance weapons, one pistol and one melee weapon like a cooking pan
+ Steam inventory displays Your collected item skins
Definitely worth the time it takes to get good

In the 2002 TV film "It's a Very Merry Muppet Christmas Movie", there's a part where an angel shows Kermit an alrernate reality where he was never born. For whatever reason, the editors didn't really think about it, and continued to use footage with the twin towers still standing for this scene; however, they aren't there in his original universe. Therefore, something that Kermit did in his life, did in fact cause 9/11 in Muppet lore.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.
