I want to give this a good rating I really do because I've played this game quite a bit over the last year and a half or so since I've owned it and I have had fun on this game before. However this game has been completely ruined for me by becoming free to play. I understand it's a knew way to bring more players to your game except it has just been an easy way for  hackers to just remake accounts over and over it seems. Now that people are able to create accounts over and over because it's free there really isn't a real way of stopping it unfortunately. There IS PUBG Shield (which you have to make an account with to even begin your attempt to report someone) but the hoops you have to go through just to get a proper report out there is kind of ridiculous. Then once you do it's not even really any moderators that see it it's other players that vote on it. Which actually can be pretty good but it just seems like they're very "hands-off". The in-game report system is pretty much useless and even PUBG has said so themselves that it's not very effective.

Also free to play bringing more players to the game and we still haven't added Duos back into the game for TPP? They made the game free and so everyone who already paid for the game got an outfit for only the female character (which you CAN place on both male and female but you know what I mean) at the very least give us an outfit for both male and female I mean we paid for the game and it's now free. There were other things given to us but honestly it really wasn't worth what we paid for the game. At least in my opinion not at all. Basically everyone got the outfit so it's not like it's this super special rare outfit. 

Casual mode seems like a game mode where if you are a beginner you can learn the ropes and to an extent that's true. If you don't count the max ranked players who play Casual to get easy kills/wins on low level players because there is no level cap for Casual. Also you can only play 3 Casual mode matches a day?? Which I can assume would be extremely frustrating for a new player trying it out for the first time and getting clapped every game by an extreme try hard lvl 500 with gold medals feeding off new players and then they're just out of Casual matches for the day. They do give you bots to fight against as well as a small number of real players in Casual though. However the bots are so incredibly mind numbing and stupid there is almost no challenge whatsoever which is not rewarding at all and doesn't really help you learn the game. I mean how are you supposed to learn how to survive against higher levels when most of the time the bots are standing completely still waiting for the blue zone to come kill them. Which honestly has an almost eerie sadness to it watching these bots just wait to die lol. Or they're walking back and forth stopping and turning around etc. Popping off a couple of shots at you from long distances or really close up but hardly ever landing a shot. Higher levels aren't usually that bad with their aim at all.

Also I don't know if they are bringing "Survivor Pass" back into the game but there is also an achievement for leveling up your Survivor Pass past the max rank and Survivor Pass ins't in the game anymore either. At least we have PUBG plus.

Absolutely worth playing. I most just play training against the AI bots to avoid hackers. Even though the AI isn't that good it's still fun. I'm surprised it's free to be honest. I thought for sure this would be at least $20 USD. I'll take a decent free game any day of the week. Especially if it has decent graphics, good gameplay, AI support and a large community to support it. This game passes the test in all those categories. I do like the battle royale. The biggest problem with games like this one where you can have like 100 plus players on a server is that the maps are usually so big, you can go literally hours and not see a single person. I used to play a game called Unturned. The servers in that game (at the time, the server are far larger now) were small. Like 24 people per server normally. But even on the servers with 150 players, the map was so big, and because there was no play boundaries like in PUBG, it was difficult to find players. And of course there were also hacker everywhere. It got to be monotonous quickly and therefore, I ended up not playing the game anymore. This may be my new favorite game for a nice relaxed, somewhat easy to win battle game. I'd normally play war games with factions, but I don't mind a goof free for all every once in a while.

This might be one of the absolute worst battle royale games i have ever played. This is because the gunplay is abhorrent, i'd wager my bet that gunplay in free indie games released by university students would feel more fun. The maps are huge and if you don't get a sniper with a long scope then you lose. The game and combat is far more fun during the hectic few minutes where the players are in close proximity scrambling for the first guns they can get their hands on. The game runs well, much better than it did a few years ago. but that being said, even on higher graphics the game looks like shit. If you are looking to play a good, free battle royale then play warzone, and if you are mentally handicapped then play fortnite i guess.

This is one of the worst FPS games I have ever played in my life, full stop. I was going to say frustrating, but the game is in reality just terribly un-fun due to oppressive tacticool mechanics. Playing this game is tantamount to mental torture. If you want to play a game where every match is you dropping in and immediately getting destroyed by someone who has mastered the nonsensical  mechanics, then this is it for you, though. You can shoot someone 10 times, but they will use their G-Fuel aided aiming to hit you once in the head. Then you will get the pleasure of going back to the main menu and queuing to do it again. There has never been another game that I have played in which the entire experience is just nagging frustration. There is no sense of pride when winning, but only relief that you didn't get matched into a lobby with someone with 10,000 hours. The only way to improve in this game is to play for 12+ hours a day for the next 5 years; this is because the folks who are still playing have been doing exactly that since 2017. If you want to become frustrated at how you are spending your time, question if you were ever good at any FPS title beforehand, and overall hate your life, than this is the game for you!

PUBG is a "military simulation" battle royale game. As a mil-sim BR, it plays much different from Warzone, Fortnite, and Apex. The biggest difference is mobility. You can't slide or fly or glide around, you are human and run/walk most places like in Tarkov. There is higher weapon recoil and more realistic bullet physics than Apex. If you want  something more arcade-like as a superhuman play Apex or Fortnite. If you want something more realistic play PUBG.

Cheating allegations are overblown and much better than the past, PUBG is on par with any other battle royale game regarding cheats. I've played over 100 matches and reported people for suspected cheating twice. This is mainly hyperbole by morons who don't understand how the game works and display their ignorance on the discussion forums.

Performance wise PUBG is less optimized than games from big studios like EA or Activision, so if you want a smooth 120 FPS at all times with no FPS drops, maybe try something else. The game sometimes fails to boot from Steam's Big Picture mode, but I've never experienced one in-game crash. Personally I have no complaints about the performance it plays perfectly fine for me. 

The biggest problem I have with PUBG is the developer Krafton's puzzling design choices. They split the game into third person perspective matches (TPP matches) and first person perspective matches (FPP matches), effectively dividing the player base in half. Why? Why divide the player base by FPP and TPP? This is so stupid, they are trying to please everyone and only end up making the game worse. 

The matches are filled with bots so out of every 100 players, at least half are bots. This is not ideal and makes the game less exciting, but it's understandable why they do this so that you can always join a match easily and it's honestly not a huge deal.

All in all I definitely recommend the game and think it's fantastic, however at the end of the day people have different tastes and this isn't everyone's cup of tea. Personally I think it's a great game and was the mil-sim BR king for years, but it does have flaws.

My love for PUBG is a weird one. The Game is pretty much what it is supposed to be. There are always some bugs or weird glitches but that doesn't really bother me. The game can be really unforgiving, but there is not a single game that comes close to the satisfaction of getting kills in this game, let alone winning a game. The gunplay is not like anything else and is also very hard. This combined with the downtime between gunfights makes this a great game for chilling with friends. There is also a lot of freedom in what types of fights you want to do. Winning with only 1 kill whilst being stealthy or getting 15 kills and going in like Rambo. It's your choice.

Dude starts to say I need to kill him, "In order to be the best I need to beat the best." I tell dude to elaborate on what he means by that. Dude says that this individual has won multiple pubg tourny's, how he needs to kill him. I tell dude so you mean to tell me that if you kill him you'r basically taking his crown?!./ Dude says that's exactly what I mean. PATHETIC!!!!-To know that this is what drives snipers to do what they do along with ip grabbers and all the discord haters. This is by far the worst sort of validation anyone can seek online. I felt bad for this individual who was being targeted.  This individual was clearly a good player and was clearly having a casual game. I chose to not participate in his plot and ran straight into an enemy without firing. This targeted individual is clearly a great player. I tried to express to Dude that even if you kill him doesn't mean you are better, he may have days/rounds where he wants to enjoy himself meaning he wont be in a TOURNY MOOD!! For instance if he wants to own he could probably flip the switch in his brain and shut down the server/ this is draining no one plays at 100% competitive mode, it's exhausting. Dude couldn't face the fact and insisted on going after him. long story short he failed. Clearly a pathetic human thinking he can take someones hard work by doing scummy things. Please be a bigger person and actually put in the work and get good. Even if you resort to being a pathetic loser and go through pathetic ways in order to target an individual it wont make you better it makes you worse. cheaters will never prosper!

Step 1
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x9 inch pan or line a muffin pan with paper liners.

Step 2
In a medium bowl, cream together the sugar and butter. Beat in the eggs, one at a time, then stir in the vanilla. Combine flour and baking powder, add to the creamed mixture and mix well. Finally stir in the milk until batter is smooth. Pour or spoon batter into the prepared pan.

Step 3
Bake for 30 to 40 minutes in the preheated oven. For cupcakes, bake 20 to 25 minutes. Cake is done when it springs back to the touch.

Bad vibes, depressing aura and atmosphere to this game. All the characters look depressing, even the ones that are meant to be dressed up and fun like clowns and T-Rex dinosaurs. Music selection makes me feel like the game is meant for some kind of zealoted American Militia radical or something. The most positive thing about this game are the dance offs that happen while the countdown is occurring before the actual match. Enough people on this game say some pretty foul things over the microphone for me to include it as a downside. In only a few hours of playing I heard the N-word mentioned, in a short match a clearly disgruntled player cursed out another player for straying from proximity of the team (both were high level) - the angry player chased him down (and I tagged along) until ultimately all our avatars were destroyed by a more cohesive team (the man clearly was not having a good day or possibly not having a good existence), and ultimately I ended up uninstalling the game after realizing: I don't need this kind of mood influence in my life - not even for free.

Welcome to *adjusts glasses* "Player Unknown Battlegrounds: Battlegrounds" or simply PUBG: Battlegrounds. A game that has been riddled with bugs, continues to have cheaters, and still has crashes to this very day.

I've been playing this game since those silly memes of "I'm a snake look at me" and "China #1!". I still remember when this BR had no competition like Fortnite or Apex. Sadly, it's a really bad game still, but I figured I'd try it out again bectit went Free to Play, so I wanted to see if we got any perks as longtime owners or if they changed anything.

No perks, but that didn't entirely bother me, but simply due to no changes. How can a game still be so bad and not address concerns? Hell, Halo MCC had bugs like no tomorrow, but they fixed the shit out of that game.

The worst offender is that I've put 100s of hours into this game, why am I being forced into a tutorial and AI matches? I'd smack the heck out of the guy who made this decision. Heck, I'd even try to be game director to actually get the devs to fix this sorry excuse of a title.

I've never really had much interest in playing PUBG, until it became free-to-play. My curiosity piqued, I downloaded it to try it out. These five hours are ones I wish I could take back.

PUBG isn't worth playing. For starters, you have to participate in ten matches against bots (or complete a specific list of achievements) in order to play with real people. I really don't understand the point of doing this. Just have the tutorial and let people play.

In my fifth match or so, I was close to winning. There was one bot left to take down. However, when I got out of my vehicle to shoot at it, the ping jumped like crazy, and I ended up being killed. How does a match against [i] bots [/i] have ping issues? That was concerning for what real matches might be like.

Sometimes when I'd land, for thirty seconds or so, building textures wouldn't load. I'd be out in the open waiting for the buildings to load properly so I could actually go in and loot them.

Finally, I beat the ten bot matches and was able to start playing with real people. I only played 3 matches before uninstalling the game. The ping issues continued, to the point where my eyes were hurting because of the lag. The game became completely unenjoyable. Looking through the reviews, I'm not the only one having these issues. And since the developers seem to have no desire to fix anything (at least on PC), I have no desire to keep playing their game.

I wanted to like this game, I really did. Elements like driving made this game fun and stand out from other battle royales. But the issues far outnumber the positive aspects. They might herald themselves as "the original battle royale" experience (which they really aren't, they just popularized the genre), but they definitely gave me one of the worst gaming experiences I've had in a while.

This game is like a hit or miss sometimes, playing duos can be really fun but it can also be VERY VERY frustrating, because this game has been out for 4 years now or something its new players will struggle to really have a good time. I find myself having the most fun when I play duos with my friend and we dont really take the game too serious. the gunfights can actually be very fun and intense and getting kill is so satisfying because of how difficult it can be to get them sometimes. it will probably take most players about 200 hours to actually be able to get a win without playing like a degenerate. 

TIP: if you want to get better either play the arcade tdm mode or land hot everytime in solos youre going to die a lot at first but trust me you will get better.

[Edit] - to address the cheater problem there are cheaters in this game however I would say I have maybe ran into like 5 cheaters out of the 2 or 3 years ive had this game for. there are probably more cheaters in COD Warzone than this game. Even after this game has gone FTP.

Battlegrounds is the midwit tier of shooters. Some tactics and thinking will certainly get you into the top 10 for each session, barring some really bad luck, but I can't take any game seriously where the human body can eat rifle rounds and still come out on top.

Still, there's enough here to make it fun if you can't afford the sim gear for DCS or don't have a crew to play Tarkov with. It's especially fun to play in a squad and make some friends, with caveats below. There are also times I really just enjoy sneaking about, outracing the blue ..stuff.. and evading players who are better at drawn out shooty engagements than I. I like the mechanic of describing your "survivor attributes" to you; I'm "decisive". Generally, I don't want to trade blows - because rifles, dammit - I want to either avoid you or end you quickly. That's how a game with rifles should be IMHO.

The multiplayer aspects of this vary. The bots are just smart enough to challenge you, but the real thrill comes from going up against other players. It's always fun to outwit the other guy or to watch your deathcam and get a good "I see what you did there!" moment. Really, unless you're a sore loser, it's often just as fun - or at least informative and educational - to get outwitted by a great player than win one over on a player on your level. Certainly more fun than hosing down newbies.

Coop, however, is my favorite - except when the team, well, isn't. The random matching unless you have guys you play with at a set time means you'll be getting luck-of-the-draw on who you get matched with. Most of the time, they don't have or aren't on comms, which makes teamwork nonexistent; and even if they are, you'll often find a language barrier because global economy, which makes teamwork nonexistent. But if you get lucky and get guys who are talking to each other, not at each other, and working together, it is awesome and really accentuates the game.

Arcade mode is where the midwittery comes out especially strong. It is usually just a run-and-gun time killer; if you're lucky you get a match on a map that offers some tactical options besides the tiresome mechanics of turning up your brightness and running about an unpredictable map in which killing as many of the other team as possible is the sole objective. It is a good place to practice aim and build up the muscle memory for the controls and that's about it. Teamwork is nonexistent despite the default mode here being teams. Avoid unless drunk.

All in all, I give this game my thumbs-up as it remains fun and challenging despite the midwittery of its execution. At least the devs have put in some serious work, and it can be a blast at times. Great way to kill some time while organizing a Tarkov crew or just looking for some escapism while buzzed.

I've been playing PUBG basically since it came out, and I have many many hours in the game.  For a while, it was great.  My buddies and I were even really good at the game, winning a few matches each time we logged in.  But now, this game has been transformed into the biggest cesspool of cheating, toxic players and removing features.  Every other game I die to "xX_Swagmaster_Sweat_Xx" or the like.  And at this point, it isn't a matter of skill.  It's a matter of the developers not caring about the state that their game is in.  I've played well before, but it feels like over the many hundreds of hours I've invested into playing this game, I've only gotten worse.  A manufactured paradox sucking the fun and life right out of this game.  There are multiple maps that you can't even play on, because they're either out of rotation, or because there's not even an option to select a map anymore.  The developers have shown us time and time again that they don't care, either by not working towards a cheating solution or a lack of game improvements.  Actually, at this point in the review, my game just now crashed.  

It's disgusting to see that someone could make a game so fun, and a game that helped bring the battle royale genre to the forefront of gaming, and then make it worse and worse as time goes on.  They don't care if you play.  They want your wallet.  Hundreds of overpriced cosmetics, battle passes, and weapon skin garbage that add NOTHING to the gameplay experience, and yet, I find more each and every time I log in.  If they put even a FRACTION of the time they put into sucking the dollar bills right out of your back pocket into gameplay and fixing the cheating problem, this game would be running as smooth as the developers brains clearly are.  I'm not the only one who's realized this either.  The reviews for PUBG have declined rapidly and sharply.  

The decision to go free to play wasn't made because they want people to have fun.  It was made because people don't want to play a game that's riddled with cheating and bugs and have to pay for it.  By installing this you are making yourself a victim.  Instead of fixing the problem, they'll laugh on a pile of money and give all the previously banned cheaters a ticket right back in.  It's FREE to cheat as many times as you want, as many new accounts as you're willing to make!  The only cost is your time!  If you must play, don't give them any of your money.  That's showing them that they can get away with screwing their community over for as long as they want to do so.  Go to Apex, go to Fortnite even.  If you want a battle royale experience where you even have a chance at winning, this game isn't for you.  I can't even FATHOM what a nightmare this must be for new players, with a steep skill curve ahead them and a rock solid wall of cheaters in their path.  As for me, I plan to keep up with PUBG on the hope that another game I once loved isn't destroyed forever.  But if you're new, don't waste your disk space on this glorified rage simulator.

Best Battle Royale. 

You can spend time playing the game, checking guides from you tube and forums, you can spend time editing your adventures and publishing them in you tube or a platform of your chosing... and you can spend time and money thinking how to optimize your rig and tactics to best suite your journey to earn the Chicken Dinner.

Been there, done that all. 

I can strongly recommend the game for those who like a bit slower shooters (or hotdropping will increase the pace...) and whom enjoy the "random" effects that can happen when facing nearly hundred other gamers chasing the elusive chicken dinner granted only for the winner. 

Every game will be different, and with friends it will have even more random events generated by plans gone awry... or those rare moments when plans are executed perfectly. You can guess which scenario is more probable to happen?

Gameplay wise the experience vary, movement is a bit rough... but the gunplay mechanics are brilliant!  This was the first big BR and after years of playing it's still my main game.  

There are some -guaranteed- annoyances after every patch, or so it feels, but they tend to quickly fix problems. Game itself is quite harsh for overclocked systems... it will quickly reveal any problems you have by quickly and repetitively crashing... untill you fix the problem or agree to safe settings.

There is a bit different feeling when choosing the perspective used: You can either play from third person perspective or first person perspective...  1st person gamelay feeling "slower" and being my favourite game type. 

After / due the change to free to play mode, there are now better chances for new players to learn the game: Tutorial missions, training field and TDM... and there might actually be a chance to get in a game with more (other) new players than being thrown straight into the deep end of the pool with hardened veterans... or so I heard from my new-to-the-game RL friends.

Check it out yourself!

I am a 65 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 23 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

You´ll read a lot about a "cheater problem" here.
Are there Cheaters`? Probably
Are there as many cheaters as reviews might suggest? No, I´ve not seen more than 10 in all my hours played (EU Servers) and playing with randoms gave me an understanding why everyone believes the game was full of cheaters.
"Yo, got killed from a cheater, I´ll delete this sh*t game" - Ran into the open and got shot from a guy 200m away while not wearing a helmet or body armor. In at least 95% of the cases people think they met a cheater, something they cannot comprehend happened... the guy was good, even better than them.
Killcam? Research on how the Unreal Engine replay works and you´ll understand.
Servers are absolutely fine, it´s your connection, leading to 300ms+ pings.

It´s boring because you have to watch you friends play another 15 minutes after you´ve been killed? Go play a game which caters to hot dropping and fast action, PUBG is slower but winning a match is a lot more satifying than in any other game in this genre (at least to me).

Also people leaving bad reviews after more than 1000 hours of playing? Yes, must be really bad! They don´t like the game obviously, otherwise they would´ve put time into it.

Stop complaining about a good game just because people are better than you, your internet is slower than a crippled turtle or you´re playing on a potato.

A fun game to play! The combat experience is varied and highly dependent on your environment and movement (and maybe your luck too). Although this game is older in the Battle Royale genre, it boasts mechanics few other games have, permanent death for example. And while many prefer a revival system or recoil-less guns, these mechanics serve to provide a more realistic life-or death definition to the genre. And perhaps the biggest boon to the game is it lower skill level. Their are sweats in most competetive games, but so far I have no problem getting a few people. The only complaint I'd have about the game is the abundance of retarded bots just stop and stare, but I suppose they supply situation experience for real-person encounters.

The game needs work. It's a fun enough, grounded game that needs changes. 

Main gripe I'm writing about is matchmaking. Not times or high ping or that, but when I queue for squads, I'd like to actually play with other people. Out of the last 5 matches I've played casually queued for squads 4 have been solo, which simply isn't fun. 

Other than that, it seems to break every third update or so. It's definitely running better than it did on release, but the optimization will only get you so far. Throw in the lack of map choice, lackluster cosmetics, and everything else that slowly adds up, you get frustrated with it.

Honestly I'd probably play more, and the recent ping system is a bright spot. But the problematic matchmaking and lack of map selection keeps this game frustrating in spite of everything it has going for it.

Player Unknown's Battlegrounds: Battlegrounds was the first of its kind to achieve commercial success as a standalone game.
Taking the core concept of the "Battle Royale" mods for ARMA II & III (somewhat inspired by Minecraft Hunger Games) and creating a fully fledged game out of it was somewhat novel, the fact that it was also fun to play even in early access was impressive!

Unfortunately the developers of this video game have made some unforgivable mistakes which mainly hurt consumers.
My least favourite part was when the developers promised to NEVER include paid gambling mechanics to the game (which they have now). They also decided to never polish or optimize the game to run well on all PC's. Instead they chose to just make more cosmetics which earned them money for a game that (at the time) cost money to even play. Now it has gone free-to-play and has a massive bot problem. Never trust KRAFTON with your money, boycot, boycot, boycot.

Why no controller support? I know it's possible. I'm aware it sucks compared to M&K but my friends want me to play this torturous game with them on consoles and I can't as far as I can tell.

Anyway, PUBG is your default battle royale. In the year of our lord 2022 it's like playing a chinese bootleg of Warzone. Expect the gold standard Battle Royale gameplay of looting and running in a straight line for 20 minutes only to die to a speck in the distance or be instakilled by a car. Graphics are pretty much the same as they've been; xbox 360-level. Feels like it's trying to have some sort of general art direction but doesn't yet know how to do that.

The guns have nice models and feel ok to fire. The maps are large and detailed with thought-out infrastructure, which keeps every encounter different. The ability to drive cars and bikes is a great way for players to survive the storm, because if you land on the outskirts of these giant maps it's a coin toss as to whether or not you'll have to drive across the map. There's a wide variety of attachments for guns and items, really allowing for a wealth of different play-styles that i'd love to see more development in. I must also add that you can finally see pings in the game world as of recently, a welcome advance in team communication.

The physics, especially car physics, can be janky at times (though they were way worse in the past). Certain movements like vaulting happen at the speed of molasses; don't expect to hop over cover in combat because you'll be vaulting like a drunken idiot for an eternity of 3 seconds, plenty of time for your opponent to mow you down. 

Pros:
- Guns that you can customize both in game with attachments and with skins
- Battle Royale, so it's great for people with gambling addictions
- Detailed maps keep things almost interesting
- Cars
- Huge map

Cons:
- Battle Royale, so get accustomed to losing all the time.
- If you're deaf or can't listen, this game will really suck because you have no way of telling where you've been shot from if you don't see a muzzle flash. Also no minimap pings on enemy gunshots.
- if you have played CoD or Apex you have tasted the forbidden fruit and you will not be satisfied by the gunplay in this. Fortnite players on the other hand will be pleased to know that the telescope on top of your gun can actually be used to make bullets hit your enemies.
- Cars don't like players and are known to kill their passengers at a whim
- Huge Map

I gotta give this game a 2 outta 5. (0 = unplayable/awful, 5 = masterpiece)

I stopped playing about 6 months after the 1.0 release a few years back. During that time I put nearly 1800 hours. The reasons I left then are the reasons I immediately uninstalled after a 3 day weekend where I played a total of 12-ish hours. 

The reason was cheating then and it it's the same reason now. 

I encountered bullet-magnet cheats, aim bot through walls, and the incredible ability for some people to down my entire squad with a single 19 round magazine on a vektor outside of 20 meters. All headshots with ammo left over.

Complaining about it only brings rabbid dogs who, for some reason, defend this game to their dying breath.

The company did implement an anti-cheat sometime between when I quit and when I started playing recently, but have done nothing to prevent chinese players from connecting to US/UK servers. 

Regardless of the fact that Brendon Green (player unknown) himself said that about 90% of hackers come from china, the horrendous ping (upwards of 400ms) that I had to play with made playing against even what seemed to be normal players a chore.

I have not and will not ever recommend this game. If you want the PUBG experience, go play Super People; it's a direct clone with it's own flavor on top.

Well, I hoped one day I would get to review this as a free-to-play game! Now I can, lets get into this.

So firstly, yeah...no regional based matchmaking. Not so good. I wanted to say that first, because it is going to effect a lot of the comments I wish to make in this review. Which as hard as I try, will still sound like I am complaining, but I'm not.

So, I will breakdown the positives. For a Solo player, if you love a challenge and you love being in the thick of it. PUBG is and has always been fantastic. The rush of looting for gear, running out a door under heavy fire through a red zone as bombs go off around you rivals the Campaign in several Call of Duty games. The weapons available are plentiful, as are attachments and character customisation is the best it has ever been, especially if your a legacy player. 

PUBG has came a long way since it's first Beta yet I still find myself a little unhappy with a few things.

Again, you cannot change your matchmaking region, this makes it very difficult to communicate in Squad based game modes for so many of us. Far too frequently you get squads with people who speak a variety of different languages. This in my opinion must change if Squad based game modes are to survive with the current Free-To-Play model. 

Secondly, the store has a lot of in-game purchases for people who want to spend their hard earned, HOWEVER! 
For the currency you earn from your results known as "BP" I am still disjointed at the fact through the full store, there are less than 6 items that you can actually buy out-right with this. 

If you wish to spend your hard earned in-game coins, you need to rely on random luck buying item crates, which double in price after each purchase. If you call yourself truly "Free-To-Play" please for the love of that Chicken Goddess give us more options to spend our currency! At the minute, PUBG is exactly "Pay to look good" because right now new players who are joining have got to be put off by this. Your charging way to much for your cosmetics and not giving new players the options to actually play for free. In my opinion, its more "run around in a generic white T-Shirt and look at all the rich people" than it is about actually introducing new players. 

All that aside, it is Batllegrounds. And it is the original Battle Royale experience, it still is and will always be a must have, try it out. It can be great with friends, great Solo. Just don't expect to look good while doing it.

Jokes aside, the game is extremely fun to play with friends who run you over with their car and shoot your helmet down, but that's okay because you do the same. Most annoying is the lvl 500 players, who should actually be lvl 201930, but 500 is the highest level you can get; so if you die it's either because of a lvl 500 or a lvl 3 who got banned before but got another account because the game is free now. You are sitting with Fallout 76 and war zone in my library basement now.

There is no way this game gets a 10. It is super buggy with rampant rubber-banding and desync. There are a lot of cheaters, which Brendan Greene talked about on the H3H3 podcast yesterday. Plus the current ranking system favors super boring camping style.

The entertainment value on Twitch is impressive, and I watch Dr. Disrespect and Viss play daily (RIP Slick Daddy Club for now though...). But the game itself is one map, with no story, and poor graphics, and terrible optimization, with lots of bugs, a good amount of hackers and cheaters - those are not the words that describe a game getting high scores from some sites. They should be ashamed. Sales and cultural impact does not make a game a 9 or 10.

It is 2022, PubG is free...  Why not download it?  Here is why.  The game play is quite terrible compared to modern titles as is the audio.  Could be some of the worst directional audio of any game I have played yet.  The fact that the devs gave up long ago and never bothered to upgrade the game engine, graphics, audio, etc...  just provide crappy skins for purchase means this game really just belongs in the battle royale history books.  Don't waste your time, there are better options now-a-days.  If you want the nostalgia of the very first real BR, then this is it, but I warn you it is infested with sweats, bugs, and hackers...  And is crushingly boring to play solo.

So far so good, i have been playing this game since release in 2017 off and on and it has come a long way. Things seem very stable now, i had one match where PuBG just closed randomly but maybe that was my fault so i can't blame anyone for that. Also i haven't come across any cheaters/hacks in a couple years so that's a good thing. Since the "Free To Play" dropped also no issues so far, if i have to update this review in the future i will. Long story short it's a fun game and takes some time to get in the flow if you aren't use to it. It can be frustrating but that's part of the experience. I like how they offer different modes and more prizes and perks for doing things. All in all it's the OG for the open world style that it is. One thing i wish they would allow is Duo's and squad training together, it would help people who are new to the game to learn from ppl with XP. Other than that i love that came. It's definitely worth the money now for sure haha.

A grenade can kill you in full hp full tier 3 gear. Grenades can be fully timed so you know exactly when to throw them and where are they going to explode.

Before the F2P update, i will admit, this game was absolutely dead, extremely difficult to get into lobbies, whilst 99% of it was bots. Now, while there are still bots, there are far more real players, that is if you are playing with a squad, from what i have found. In solos there are less players, more bots. but if you get a good squad with good comms and "decent" aim, you are 85% going to win the game. 

Therefore, If you are a good squad member and like playing with people, and have good communication. then you will love pubg in it's current state, if you are a more of a solo player, then it probably is not for you at the moment unfortunately, with the amount of bots in solos. 

Cheers

First time I met with PUBG was about three years ago. I was playing on console and having lots of fun. Last year (2021) I heard something about it coming free so I took my time and was checking on it once in a while. I didnt BUY this game really because of these "Cheater" comments. Ive only played for about 29 hours and let me tell you. I have NOT seen any cheater yet. If there would be so much cheaters as reviews say, Id run upon a cheater every game. Im new to it only on pc, (like I said previously, Ive played this game for hundreds of hours on ps4) but the game is just a masterpiece, some people say its too slow for them - go play DayZ, this will show you what is slow. You can choose your own way to play, aggressive or passive. Either land in Bootcamp and get slayed calling them cheaters or go land in some sort of houses on the shore. I absolutely LOVE this game and will play it as I used to. I am very happy with developers making it free. Of course, Its a bit limited and of course, there ARE going to be more cheaters since the game is free but its absolutely worth your time. All you need is your couple or even one friend that you can play with. Its fun alone, but much better with friends. Whenever I get tired of this game I still come back to it in a week because Its just so satisfying to win and kill other players. I recommend. Anyway, where we dropping?

The continued development of technology will worsen the situation 📞➡️📱➡️⌚️➡️❓. It will certainly subject human beings 👨‍💼👩‍💻👩‍🎓🕵️‍♂️👨‍🏫👨‍🎨👰 to greater indignities and inflict greater damage on the natural world 🌲😢🌳, it will probably lead to greater social disruption 😱 and psychological suffering 🧠⛏️, and it may lead to increased physical suffering even in “advanced” countries 🇸🇬🇨🇦 🇪🇸🇸🇪.

2️⃣. The industrial-technological system may survive 🍃 or it may break down 🍂. If it survives, it MAY eventually achieve a low ⬇️ level of physical 💪 and psychological 🧠 suffering, but only after passing through a long 🕐🕑🕒🕒🕓🕔🕕🕖🕗🕘🕙🕚🕛🕜🕝🕞🕟🕠🕡🕢🕣🕤🕥🕦🕧and very painful 🤕 period of adjustment and only at the cost 💰 of permanently reducing human beings and many other living organisms 👨👩‍🦰🐼🦁🐷🐸🐱 to engineered 👷‍♂️👷‍♀️ products and mere cogs ⚙️ in the social machine. Furthermore, if the system survives, the consequences will be inevitable 💯: There is no way of reforming 💭 or modifying ❗️ the system so as to prevent it from depriving people of dignity and autonomy🔓.

3️⃣. If the system breaks 💔 down the consequences will still be very painful 🤕. But the bigger 💪 the system grows ⬆️ the more disastrous the results of its breakdown will be, so if it is to break down it had best break down sooner 🔜 rather than later 🔚.

4️⃣. We therefore advocate a revolution ✊against the industrial system 🏭. This revolution may or may not make use of violence 🔫; it may be sudden 💥 or it may be a relatively gradual process 📈spanning a few decades. We can’t predict 🔮 any of that. But we do outline 🔲 in a very general way the measures 📏 that those who hate the industrial system 🏗 should take in order to prepare the way for a revolution ✊ against that form of society. This is not to be a POLITICAL 🏛revolution. Its object will be to overthrow not governments but the ecoqnomic 💰 and technological 💻 basis of the present society.

5️⃣. In this article we give attention to only some of the negative 👎 developments that have grown out of the industrial-technological 🏗📱 system. Other such developments we mention only briefly ⏱or ignore altogether. This does not mean that we regard these other developments as unimportant 🚫. For practical reasons we have to confine ⛓️ our discussion to areas that have received insufficient public attention or in which we have something 🆕 to say. For example, since there are well-developed environmental ♻️ and wilderness 🌱🌳🍃movements, we have written 📝 very little about environmental degradation 📉or the destruction of wild nature, even though we consider these to be highly important ❗️.

Game has had a ton of fixes! Also it's free!! I have totally gotten addicted to it. LUL. I play mainly battle royales (Warzone, Fortnite etc), and this game is different. It not only has the battle royale aspect, but you loot as well. Kinda reminds me of Escape From Tarkov mixed with Warzone LUL. Game is way better balanced. I always see people complaining about hackers and yet you're going to get that in any game, especially Warzone. But honestly i haven't ran into any yet playing PubG, that i know of LUL. Anyway i highly reccomend this game if you are anything like me, I play a game that i like until i get good at it, and there is a point i get bored with playing the same game. So PubG going free while i can feel myself get bored of Warzone was perfect timing. Now i can take a break from it and play this game which is a pretty cool game!

If you are looking for a fun Battle Royale experience, this is not the game for you. PubG is best described as fortnite if you took away everything fun about it. The game is uninspired, unoriginal, and tedious. More than half the players in any given match are going to be half programmed bots that are as likely to die from glitching out than in an actual fire fight.

Beyond that, PubG is so greedy they make literally every other Battle Royale game look honest. Somehow they have managed to turn almost every interaction with the server into a micro-transaction. Most egregiously they will force you to pay $10 to change your username. Ten dollars to change a single line of code on a server. Who do they think they are, Microsoft? It's unbelievable. 

What's more unbelievable is that this isn't a new behavior. The game just went Free-To-Play. You used to have to spend money to get this experience.

Fortnite may steal from other games, but at least they don't try and steal from their own players. Play literally any other Battle Royale before you play this garbage.

There was a time where PUBG content were flooding my facebook feed because of its popularity, bringing a unique style  of shooting game by pitting 100 players against each other. I never had the opportunity to buy it because I lack the funds to do so. Instead,  I went and play  PUBGM (after years since the game was out)  to at least try my hands  on the said  game  despite being so late to play it. Once I got my very  own PC I  had  this  on my wishlist and was readying to buy it this January. Fortunately, it became  Free to Play so thank you for that! As expected, the  experience  is amazing despite having  difficulty to compete to some of the  veterans in this game. But  what's a little bit of challenge to improve yourself, right? Overall, because of this migration  to F2P,  PUBG has once again made noise.
